PERSONAE.TITLE: Dramatis Personae
PERSONAE.PERSONA: SILIUS, an officer in Ventidius's army.
EUPHRONIUS, an ambassador from Antony to Caesar.
OCTAVIA, sister to Caesar and wife to Antony.
Officers, Soldiers, Messengers, and other Attendants.

PLAY.SCNDESCR: SCENE In several parts of the Roman empire.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Alexandria. A room in CLEOPATRA's palace.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PHILO
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, but this dotage of our general's
O'erflows the measure: those his goodly eyes,
That o'er the files and musters of the war
Have glow'd like plated Mars, now bend, now turn,
The office and devotion of their view
Upon a tawny front: his captain's heart,
Which in the scuffles of great fights hath burst
The buckles on his breast, reneges all temper,
And is become the bellows and the fan
To cool a gipsy's lust.
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: Flourish. Enter ANTONY, CLEOPATRA, her Ladies, the Train, with Eunuchs fanning her
SPEECH.LINE: Look, where they come:
Take but good note, and you shall see in him.
The triple pillar of the world transform'd
Into a strumpet's fool: behold and see.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: If it be love indeed, tell me how much.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: There's beggary in the love that can be reckon'd.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: I'll set a bourn how far to be beloved.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Then must thou needs find out new heaven, new earth.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Attendant
SPEECH.LINE: News, my good lord, from Rome.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Grates me: the sum.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, hear them, Antony:
Fulvia perchance is angry; or, who knows
If the scarce-bearded Caesar have not sent
His powerful mandate to you, 'Do this, or this;
Take in that kingdom, and enfranchise that;
Perform 't, or else we damn thee.'

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: How, my love!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Perchance! nay, and most like:
You must not stay here longer, your dismission
Is come from Caesar; therefore hear it, Antony.
Where's Fulvia's process? Caesar's I would say? both?
Call in the messengers. As I am Egypt's queen,
Thou blushest, Antony; and that blood of thine
Is Caesar's homager: else so thy cheek pays shame
When shrill-tongued Fulvia scolds. The messengers!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Let Rome in Tiber melt, and the wide arch
Of the ranged empire fall! Here is my space.
Kingdoms are clay: our dungy earth alike
Feeds beast as man: the nobleness of life
Is to do thus; when such a mutual pair
And such a twain can do't, in which I bind,
On pain of punishment, the world to weet
We stand up peerless.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Excellent falsehood!
Why did he marry Fulvia, and not love her?
I'll seem the fool I am not; Antony
Will be himself.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: But stirr'd by Cleopatra.
Now, for the love of Love and her soft hours,
Let's not confound the time with conference harsh:
There's not a minute of our lives should stretch
Without some pleasure now. What sport tonight?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Hear the ambassadors.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Fie, wrangling queen!
Whom every thing becomes, to chide, to laugh,
To weep; whose every passion fully strives
To make itself, in thee, fair and admired!
No messenger, but thine; and all alone
To-night we'll wander through the streets and note
The qualities of people. Come, my queen;
Last night you did desire it: speak not to us.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Exeunt MARK ANTONY and CLEOPATRA with their train

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DEMETRIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Is Caesar with Antonius prized so slight?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PHILO
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, sometimes, when he is not Antony,
He comes too short of that great property
Which still should go with Antony.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DEMETRIUS
SPEECH.LINE: I am full sorry
That he approves the common liar, who
Thus speaks of him at Rome: but I will hope
Of better deeds to-morrow. Rest you happy!

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. The same. Another room.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter CHARMIAN, IRAS, ALEXAS, and a Soothsayer

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Lord Alexas, sweet Alexas, most any thing Alexas,
almost most absolute Alexas, where's the soothsayer
that you praised so to the queen? O, that I knew
this husband, which, you say, must charge his horns
with garlands!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ALEXAS
SPEECH.LINE: Soothsayer!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soothsayer
SPEECH.LINE: Your will?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Is this the man? Is't you, sir, that know things?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soothsayer
SPEECH.LINE: In nature's infinite book of secrecy
A little I can read.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ALEXAS
SPEECH.LINE: Show him your hand.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Bring in the banquet quickly; wine enough
Cleopatra's health to drink.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Good sir, give me good fortune.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soothsayer
SPEECH.LINE: I make not, but foresee.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Pray, then, foresee me one.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soothsayer
SPEECH.LINE: You shall be yet far fairer than you are.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: He means in flesh.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: IRAS
SPEECH.LINE: No, you shall paint when you are old.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Wrinkles forbid!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ALEXAS
SPEECH.LINE: Vex not his prescience; be attentive.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Hush!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soothsayer
SPEECH.LINE: You shall be more beloving than beloved.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: I had rather heat my liver with drinking.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ALEXAS
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, hear him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Good now, some excellent fortune! Let me be married
to three kings in a forenoon, and widow them all:
let me have a child at fifty, to whom Herod of Jewry
may do homage: find me to marry me with Octavius
Caesar, and companion me with my mistress.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soothsayer
SPEECH.LINE: You shall outlive the lady whom you serve.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: O excellent! I love long life better than figs.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soothsayer
SPEECH.LINE: You have seen and proved a fairer former fortune
Than that which is to approach.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Then belike my children shall have no names:
prithee, how many boys and wenches must I have?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soothsayer
SPEECH.LINE: If every of your wishes had a womb.
And fertile every wish, a million.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Out, fool! I forgive thee for a witch.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ALEXAS
SPEECH.LINE: You think none but your sheets are privy to your wishes.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, come, tell Iras hers.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ALEXAS
SPEECH.LINE: We'll know all our fortunes.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Mine, and most of our fortunes, to-night, shall
be--drunk to bed.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: IRAS
SPEECH.LINE: There's a palm presages chastity, if nothing else.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: E'en as the o'erflowing Nilus presageth famine.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: IRAS
SPEECH.LINE: Go, you wild bedfellow, you cannot soothsay.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, if an oily palm be not a fruitful
prognostication, I cannot scratch mine ear. Prithee,
tell her but a worky-day fortune.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soothsayer
SPEECH.LINE: Your fortunes are alike.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: IRAS
SPEECH.LINE: But how, but how? give me particulars.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soothsayer
SPEECH.LINE: I have said.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: IRAS
SPEECH.LINE: Am I not an inch of fortune better than she?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Well, if you were but an inch of fortune better than
I, where would you choose it?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: IRAS
SPEECH.LINE: Not in my husband's nose.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Our worser thoughts heavens mend! Alexas,--come,
his fortune, his fortune! O, let him marry a woman
that cannot go, sweet Isis, I beseech thee! and let
her die too, and give him a worse! and let worst
follow worse, till the worst of all follow him
laughing to his grave, fifty-fold a cuckold! Good
Isis, hear me this prayer, though thou deny me a
matter of more weight; good Isis, I beseech thee!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: IRAS
SPEECH.LINE: Amen. Dear goddess, hear that prayer of the people!
for, as it is a heartbreaking to see a handsome man
loose-wived, so it is a deadly sorrow to behold a
foul knave uncuckolded: therefore, dear Isis, keep
decorum, and fortune him accordingly!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Amen.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ALEXAS
SPEECH.LINE: Lo, now, if it lay in their hands to make me a
cuckold, they would make themselves whores, but
they'ld do't!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Hush! here comes Antony.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Not he; the queen.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Saw you my lord?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: No, lady.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Was he not here?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: No, madam.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: He was disposed to mirth; but on the sudden
A Roman thought hath struck him. Enobarbus!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Madam?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Seek him, and bring him hither.
Where's Alexas?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ALEXAS
SPEECH.LINE: Here, at your service. My lord approaches.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: We will not look upon him: go with us.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter MARK ANTONY with a Messenger and Attendants

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Fulvia thy wife first came into the field.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Against my brother Lucius?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Ay:
But soon that war had end, and the time's state
Made friends of them, joining their force 'gainst Caesar;
Whose better issue in the war, from Italy,
Upon the first encounter, drave them.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Well, what worst?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: The nature of bad news infects the teller.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: When it concerns the fool or coward. On:
Things that are past are done with me. 'Tis thus:
Who tells me true, though in his tale lie death,
I hear him as he flatter'd.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Labienus--
This is stiff news--hath, with his Parthian force,
Extended Asia from Euphrates;
His conquering banner shook from Syria
To Lydia and to Ionia; Whilst--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Antony, thou wouldst say,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: O, my lord!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Speak to me home, mince not the general tongue:
Name Cleopatra as she is call'd in Rome;
Rail thou in Fulvia's phrase; and taunt my faults
With such full licence as both truth and malice
Have power to utter. O, then we bring forth weeds,
When our quick minds lie still; and our ills told us
Is as our earing. Fare thee well awhile.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: At your noble pleasure.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: From Sicyon, ho, the news! Speak there!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Attendant
SPEECH.LINE: The man from Sicyon,--is there such an one?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Attendant
SPEECH.LINE: He stays upon your will.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Let him appear.
These strong Egyptian fetters I must break,
Or lose myself in dotage.
What are you?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Fulvia thy wife is dead.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Where died she?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: In Sicyon:
Her length of sickness, with what else more serious
Importeth thee to know, this bears.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Forbear me.
There's a great spirit gone! Thus did I desire it:
What our contempt doth often hurl from us,
We wish it ours again; the present pleasure,
By revolution lowering, does become
The opposite of itself: she's good, being gone;
The hand could pluck her back that shoved her on.
I must from this enchanting queen break off:
Ten thousand harms, more than the ills I know,
My idleness doth hatch. How now! Enobarbus!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: What's your pleasure, sir?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I must with haste from hence.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Why, then, we kill all our women:
we see how mortal an unkindness is to them;
if they suffer our departure, death's the word.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I must be gone.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Under a compelling occasion, let women die; it were
pity to cast them away for nothing; though, between
them and a great cause, they should be esteemed
nothing. Cleopatra, catching but the least noise of
this, dies instantly; I have seen her die twenty
times upon far poorer moment: I do think there is
mettle in death, which commits some loving act upon
her, she hath such a celerity in dying.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: She is cunning past man's thought.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Alack, sir, no; her passions are made of nothing but
the finest part of pure love: we cannot call her
winds and waters sighs and tears; they are greater
storms and tempests than almanacs can report: this
cannot be cunning in her; if it be, she makes a
shower of rain as well as Jove.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Would I had never seen her.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: O, sir, you had then left unseen a wonderful piece
of work; which not to have been blest withal would
have discredited your travel.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Fulvia is dead.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Sir?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Fulvia is dead.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Fulvia!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Dead.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Why, sir, give the gods a thankful sacrifice. When
it pleaseth their deities to take the wife of a man
from him, it shows to man the tailors of the earth;
comforting therein, that when old robes are worn
out, there are members to make new. If there were
no more women but Fulvia, then had you indeed a cut,
and the case to be lamented: this grief is crowned
with consolation; your old smock brings forth a new
petticoat: and indeed the tears live in an onion
that should water this sorrow.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: The business she hath broached in the state
Cannot endure my absence.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: And the business you have broached here cannot be
without you; especially that of Cleopatra's, which
wholly depends on your abode.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: No more light answers. Let our officers
Have notice what we purpose. I shall break
The cause of our expedience to the queen,
And get her leave to part. For not alone
The death of Fulvia, with more urgent touches,
Do strongly speak to us; but the letters too
Of many our contriving friends in Rome
Petition us at home: Sextus Pompeius
Hath given the dare to Caesar, and commands
The empire of the sea: our slippery people,
Whose love is never link'd to the deserver
Till his deserts are past, begin to throw
Pompey the Great and all his dignities
Upon his son; who, high in name and power,
Higher than both in blood and life, stands up
For the main soldier: whose quality, going on,
The sides o' the world may danger: much is breeding,
Which, like the courser's hair, hath yet but life,
And not a serpent's poison. Say, our pleasure,
To such whose place is under us, requires
Our quick remove from hence.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: I shall do't.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. The same. Another room.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and ALEXAS

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Where is he?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: I did not see him since.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: See where he is, who's with him, what he does:
I did not send you: if you find him sad,
Say I am dancing; if in mirth, report
That I am sudden sick: quick, and return.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Madam, methinks, if you did love him dearly,
You do not hold the method to enforce
The like from him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: What should I do, I do not?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: In each thing give him way, cross him nothing.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Thou teachest like a fool; the way to lose him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Tempt him not so too far; I wish, forbear:
In time we hate that which we often fear.
But here comes Antony.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: I am sick and sullen.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I am sorry to give breathing to my purpose,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Help me away, dear Charmian; I shall fall:
It cannot be thus long, the sides of nature
Will not sustain it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Now, my dearest queen,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Pray you, stand further from me.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: What's the matter?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: I know, by that same eye, there's some good news.
What says the married woman? You may go:
Would she had never given you leave to come!
Let her not say 'tis I that keep you here:
I have no power upon you; hers you are.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: The gods best know,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: O, never was there queen
So mightily betray'd! yet at the first
I saw the treasons planted.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Cleopatra,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Why should I think you can be mine and true,
Though you in swearing shake the throned gods,
Who have been false to Fulvia? Riotous madness,
To be entangled with those mouth-made vows,
Which break themselves in swearing!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Most sweet queen,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, pray you, seek no colour for your going,
But bid farewell, and go: when you sued staying,
Then was the time for words: no going then;
Eternity was in our lips and eyes,
Bliss in our brows' bent; none our parts so poor,
But was a race of heaven: they are so still,
Or thou, the greatest soldier of the world,
Art turn'd the greatest liar.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: How now, lady!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: I would I had thy inches; thou shouldst know
There were a heart in Egypt.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Hear me, queen:
The strong necessity of time commands
Our services awhile; but my full heart
Remains in use with you. Our Italy
Shines o'er with civil swords: Sextus Pompeius
Makes his approaches to the port of Rome:
Equality of two domestic powers
Breed scrupulous faction: the hated, grown to strength,
Are newly grown to love: the condemn'd Pompey,
Rich in his father's honour, creeps apace,
Into the hearts of such as have not thrived
Upon the present state, whose numbers threaten;
And quietness, grown sick of rest, would purge
By any desperate change: my more particular,
And that which most with you should safe my going,
Is Fulvia's death.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Though age from folly could not give me freedom,
It does from childishness: can Fulvia die?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: She's dead, my queen:
Look here, and at thy sovereign leisure read
The garboils she awaked; at the last, best:
See when and where she died.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: O most false love!
Where be the sacred vials thou shouldst fill
With sorrowful water? Now I see, I see,
In Fulvia's death, how mine received shall be.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Quarrel no more, but be prepared to know
The purposes I bear; which are, or cease,
As you shall give the advice. By the fire
That quickens Nilus' slime, I go from hence
Thy soldier, servant; making peace or war
As thou affect'st.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Cut my lace, Charmian, come;
But let it be: I am quickly ill, and well,
So Antony loves.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: My precious queen, forbear;
And give true evidence to his love, which stands
An honourable trial.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: So Fulvia told me.
I prithee, turn aside and weep for her,
Then bid adieu to me, and say the tears
Belong to Egypt: good now, play one scene
Of excellent dissembling; and let it look
Life perfect honour.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: You'll heat my blood: no more.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: You can do better yet; but this is meetly.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Now, by my sword,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: And target. Still he mends;
But this is not the best. Look, prithee, Charmian,
How this Herculean Roman does become
The carriage of his chafe.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I'll leave you, lady.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Courteous lord, one word.
Sir, you and I must part, but that's not it:
Sir, you and I have loved, but there's not it;
That you know well: something it is I would,
O, my oblivion is a very Antony,
And I am all forgotten.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: But that your royalty
Holds idleness your subject, I should take you
For idleness itself.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis sweating labour
To bear such idleness so near the heart
As Cleopatra this. But, sir, forgive me;
Since my becomings kill me, when they do not
Eye well to you: your honour calls you hence;
Therefore be deaf to my unpitied folly.
And all the gods go with you! upon your sword
Sit laurel victory! and smooth success
Be strew'd before your feet!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Let us go. Come;
Our separation so abides, and flies,
That thou, residing here, go'st yet with me,
And I, hence fleeting, here remain with thee. Away!

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, reading a letter, LEPIDUS, and their Train

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: You may see, Lepidus, and henceforth know,
It is not Caesar's natural vice to hate
Our great competitor: from Alexandria
This is the news: he fishes, drinks, and wastes
The lamps of night in revel; is not more man-like
Than Cleopatra; nor the queen of Ptolemy
More womanly than he; hardly gave audience, or
Vouchsafed to think he had partners: you shall find there
A man who is the abstract of all faults
That all men follow.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: I must not think there are
Evils enow to darken all his goodness:
His faults in him seem as the spots of heaven,
More fiery by night's blackness; hereditary,
Rather than purchased; what he cannot change,
Than what he chooses.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: You are too indulgent. Let us grant, it is not
Amiss to tumble on the bed of Ptolemy;
To give a kingdom for a mirth; to sit
And keep the turn of tippling with a slave;
To reel the streets at noon, and stand the buffet
With knaves that smell of sweat: say this
becomes him,--
As his composure must be rare indeed
Whom these things cannot blemish,--yet must Antony
No way excuse his soils, when we do bear
So great weight in his lightness. If he fill'd
His vacancy with his voluptuousness,
Full surfeits, and the dryness of his bones,
Call on him for't: but to confound such time,
That drums him from his sport, and speaks as loud
As his own state and ours,--'tis to be chid
As we rate boys, who, being mature in knowledge,
Pawn their experience to their present pleasure,
And so rebel to judgment.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Here's more news.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Thy biddings have been done; and every hour,
Most noble Caesar, shalt thou have report
How 'tis abroad. Pompey is strong at sea;
And it appears he is beloved of those
That only have fear'd Caesar: to the ports
The discontents repair, and men's reports
Give him much wrong'd.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: I should have known no less.
It hath been taught us from the primal state,
That he which is was wish'd until he were;
And the ebb'd man, ne'er loved till ne'er worth love,
Comes dear'd by being lack'd. This common body,
Like to a vagabond flag upon the stream,
Goes to and back, lackeying the varying tide,
To rot itself with motion.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Caesar, I bring thee word,
Menecrates and Menas, famous pirates,
Make the sea serve them, which they ear and wound
With keels of every kind: many hot inroads
They make in Italy; the borders maritime
Lack blood to think on't, and flush youth revolt:
No vessel can peep forth, but 'tis as soon
Taken as seen; for Pompey's name strikes more
Than could his war resisted.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Antony,
Leave thy lascivious wassails. When thou once
Wast beaten from Modena, where thou slew'st
Hirtius and Pansa, consuls, at thy heel
Did famine follow; whom thou fought'st against,
Though daintily brought up, with patience more
Than savages could suffer: thou didst drink
The stale of horses, and the gilded puddle
Which beasts would cough at: thy palate then did deign
The roughest berry on the rudest hedge;
Yea, like the stag, when snow the pasture sheets,
The barks of trees thou browsed'st; on the Alps
It is reported thou didst eat strange flesh,
Which some did die to look on: and all this--
It wounds thine honour that I speak it now--
Was borne so like a soldier, that thy cheek
So much as lank'd not.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis pity of him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Let his shames quickly
Drive him to Rome: 'tis time we twain
Did show ourselves i' the field; and to that end
Assemble we immediate council: Pompey
Thrives in our idleness.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: To-morrow, Caesar,
I shall be furnish'd to inform you rightly
Both what by sea and land I can be able
To front this present time.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Till which encounter,
It is my business too. Farewell.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Farewell, my lord: what you shall know meantime
Of stirs abroad, I shall beseech you, sir,
To let me be partaker.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Doubt not, sir;
I knew it for my bond.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE V. Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and MARDIAN

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Charmian!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Madam?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Ha, ha!
Give me to drink mandragora.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Why, madam?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: That I might sleep out this great gap of time
My Antony is away.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: You think of him too much.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: O, 'tis treason!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Madam, I trust, not so.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Thou, eunuch Mardian!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARDIAN
SPEECH.LINE: What's your highness' pleasure?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Not now to hear thee sing; I take no pleasure
In aught an eunuch has: 'tis well for thee,
That, being unseminar'd, thy freer thoughts
May not fly forth of Egypt. Hast thou affections?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARDIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Yes, gracious madam.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Indeed!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARDIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Not in deed, madam; for I can do nothing
But what indeed is honest to be done:
Yet have I fierce affections, and think
What Venus did with Mars.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: O Charmian,
Where think'st thou he is now? Stands he, or sits he?
Or does he walk? or is he on his horse?
O happy horse, to bear the weight of Antony!
Do bravely, horse! for wot'st thou whom thou movest?
The demi-Atlas of this earth, the arm
And burgonet of men. He's speaking now,
Or murmuring 'Where's my serpent of old Nile?'
For so he calls me: now I feed myself
With most delicious poison. Think on me,
That am with Phoebus' amorous pinches black,
And wrinkled deep in time? Broad-fronted Caesar,
When thou wast here above the ground, I was
A morsel for a monarch: and great Pompey
Would stand and make his eyes grow in my brow;
There would he anchor his aspect and die
With looking on his life.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ALEXAS
SPEECH.LINE: Sovereign of Egypt, hail!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: How much unlike art thou Mark Antony!
Yet, coming from him, that great medicine hath
With his tinct gilded thee.
How goes it with my brave Mark Antony?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ALEXAS
SPEECH.LINE: Last thing he did, dear queen,
He kiss'd,--the last of many doubled kisses,--
This orient pearl. His speech sticks in my heart.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Mine ear must pluck it thence.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ALEXAS
SPEECH.LINE: 'Good friend,' quoth he,
'Say, the firm Roman to great Egypt sends
This treasure of an oyster; at whose foot,
To mend the petty present, I will piece
Her opulent throne with kingdoms; all the east,
Say thou, shall call her mistress.' So he nodded,
And soberly did mount an arm-gaunt steed,
Who neigh'd so high, that what I would have spoke
Was beastly dumb'd by him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: What, was he sad or merry?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ALEXAS
SPEECH.LINE: Like to the time o' the year between the extremes
Of hot and cold, he was nor sad nor merry.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: O well-divided disposition! Note him,
Note him good Charmian, 'tis the man; but note him:
He was not sad, for he would shine on those
That make their looks by his; he was not merry,
Which seem'd to tell them his remembrance lay
In Egypt with his joy; but between both:
O heavenly mingle! Be'st thou sad or merry,
The violence of either thee becomes,
So does it no man else. Met'st thou my posts?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ALEXAS
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, madam, twenty several messengers:
Why do you send so thick?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Who's born that day
When I forget to send to Antony,
Shall die a beggar. Ink and paper, Charmian.
Welcome, my good Alexas. Did I, Charmian,
Ever love Caesar so?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: O that brave Caesar!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Be choked with such another emphasis!
Say, the brave Antony.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: The valiant Caesar!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: By Isis, I will give thee bloody teeth,
If thou with Caesar paragon again
My man of men.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: By your most gracious pardon,
I sing but after you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: My salad days,
When I was green in judgment: cold in blood,
To say as I said then! But, come, away;
Get me ink and paper:
He shall have every day a several greeting,
Or I'll unpeople Egypt.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Messina. POMPEY's house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter POMPEY, MENECRATES, and MENAS, in warlike manner

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: If the great gods be just, they shall assist
The deeds of justest men.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENECRATES
SPEECH.LINE: Know, worthy Pompey,
That what they do delay, they not deny.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Whiles we are suitors to their throne, decays
The thing we sue for.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENECRATES
SPEECH.LINE: We, ignorant of ourselves,
Beg often our own harms, which the wise powers
Deny us for our good; so find we profit
By losing of our prayers.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: I shall do well:
The people love me, and the sea is mine;
My powers are crescent, and my auguring hope
Says it will come to the full. Mark Antony
In Egypt sits at dinner, and will make
No wars without doors: Caesar gets money where
He loses hearts: Lepidus flatters both,
Of both is flatter'd; but he neither loves,
Nor either cares for him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Caesar and Lepidus
Are in the field: a mighty strength they carry.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Where have you this? 'tis false.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: From Silvius, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: He dreams: I know they are in Rome together,
Looking for Antony. But all the charms of love,
Salt Cleopatra, soften thy waned lip!
Let witchcraft join with beauty, lust with both!
Tie up the libertine in a field of feasts,
Keep his brain fuming; Epicurean cooks
Sharpen with cloyless sauce his appetite;
That sleep and feeding may prorogue his honour
Even till a Lethe'd dulness!
How now, Varrius!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: VARRIUS
SPEECH.LINE: This is most certain that I shall deliver:
Mark Antony is every hour in Rome
Expected: since he went from Egypt 'tis
A space for further travel.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: I could have given less matter
A better ear. Menas, I did not think
This amorous surfeiter would have donn'd his helm
For such a petty war: his soldiership
Is twice the other twain: but let us rear
The higher our opinion, that our stirring
Can from the lap of Egypt's widow pluck
The ne'er-lust-wearied Antony.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: I cannot hope
Caesar and Antony shall well greet together:
His wife that's dead did trespasses to Caesar;
His brother warr'd upon him; although, I think,
Not moved by Antony.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: I know not, Menas,
How lesser enmities may give way to greater.
Were't not that we stand up against them all,
'Twere pregnant they should square between
themselves;
For they have entertained cause enough
To draw their swords: but how the fear of us
May cement their divisions and bind up
The petty difference, we yet not know.
Be't as our gods will have't! It only stands
Our lives upon to use our strongest hands.
Come, Menas.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. Rome. The house of LEPIDUS.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Good Enobarbus, 'tis a worthy deed,
And shall become you well, to entreat your captain
To soft and gentle speech.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: I shall entreat him
To answer like himself: if Caesar move him,
Let Antony look over Caesar's head
And speak as loud as Mars. By Jupiter,
Were I the wearer of Antonius' beard,
I would not shave't to-day.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis not a time
For private stomaching.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Every time
Serves for the matter that is then born in't.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: But small to greater matters must give way.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Not if the small come first.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Your speech is passion:
But, pray you, stir no embers up. Here comes
The noble Antony.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: And yonder, Caesar.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, MECAENAS, and AGRIPPA

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: If we compose well here, to Parthia:
Hark, Ventidius.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: I do not know,
Mecaenas; ask Agrippa.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Noble friends,
That which combined us was most great, and let not
A leaner action rend us. What's amiss,
May it be gently heard: when we debate
Our trivial difference loud, we do commit
Murder in healing wounds: then, noble partners,
The rather, for I earnestly beseech,
Touch you the sourest points with sweetest terms,
Nor curstness grow to the matter.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis spoken well.
Were we before our armies, and to fight.
I should do thus.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Welcome to Rome.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Thank you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Sit.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Sit, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, then.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I learn, you take things ill which are not so,
Or being, concern you not.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: I must be laugh'd at,
If, or for nothing or a little, I
Should say myself offended, and with you
Chiefly i' the world; more laugh'd at, that I should
Once name you derogately, when to sound your name
It not concern'd me.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: My being in Egypt, Caesar,
What was't to you?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: No more than my residing here at Rome
Might be to you in Egypt: yet, if you there
Did practise on my state, your being in Egypt
Might be my question.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: How intend you, practised?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: You may be pleased to catch at mine intent
By what did here befal me. Your wife and brother
Made wars upon me; and their contestation
Was theme for you, you were the word of war.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: You do mistake your business; my brother never
Did urge me in his act: I did inquire it;
And have my learning from some true reports,
That drew their swords with you. Did he not rather
Discredit my authority with yours;
And make the wars alike against my stomach,
Having alike your cause? Of this my letters
Before did satisfy you. If you'll patch a quarrel,
As matter whole you have not to make it with,
It must not be with this.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: You praise yourself
By laying defects of judgment to me; but
You patch'd up your excuses.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Not so, not so;
I know you could not lack, I am certain on't,
Very necessity of this thought, that I,
Your partner in the cause 'gainst which he fought,
Could not with graceful eyes attend those wars
Which fronted mine own peace. As for my wife,
I would you had her spirit in such another:
The third o' the world is yours; which with a snaffle
You may pace easy, but not such a wife.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Would we had all such wives, that the men might go
to wars with the women!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: So much uncurbable, her garboils, Caesar
Made out of her impatience, which not wanted
Shrewdness of policy too, I grieving grant
Did you too much disquiet: for that you must
But say, I could not help it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: I wrote to you
When rioting in Alexandria; you
Did pocket up my letters, and with taunts
Did gibe my missive out of audience.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Sir,
He fell upon me ere admitted: then
Three kings I had newly feasted, and did want
Of what I was i' the morning: but next day
I told him of myself; which was as much
As to have ask'd him pardon. Let this fellow
Be nothing of our strife; if we contend,
Out of our question wipe him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: You have broken
The article of your oath; which you shall never
Have tongue to charge me with.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Soft, Caesar!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: No,
Lepidus, let him speak:
The honour is sacred which he talks on now,
Supposing that I lack'd it. But, on, Caesar;
The article of my oath.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: To lend me arms and aid when I required them;
The which you both denied.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Neglected, rather;
And then when poison'd hours had bound me up
From mine own knowledge. As nearly as I may,
I'll play the penitent to you: but mine honesty
Shall not make poor my greatness, nor my power
Work without it. Truth is, that Fulvia,
To have me out of Egypt, made wars here;
For which myself, the ignorant motive, do
So far ask pardon as befits mine honour
To stoop in such a case.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis noble spoken.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MECAENAS
SPEECH.LINE: If it might please you, to enforce no further
The griefs between ye: to forget them quite
Were to remember that the present need
Speaks to atone you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Worthily spoken, Mecaenas.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Or, if you borrow one another's love for the
instant, you may, when you hear no more words of
Pompey, return it again: you shall have time to
wrangle in when you have nothing else to do.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Thou art a soldier only: speak no more.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: That truth should be silent I had almost forgot.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: You wrong this presence; therefore speak no more.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Go to, then; your considerate stone.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: I do not much dislike the matter, but
The manner of his speech; for't cannot be
We shall remain in friendship, our conditions
So differing in their acts. Yet if I knew
What hoop should hold us stanch, from edge to edge
O' the world I would pursue it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Give me leave, Caesar,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Speak, Agrippa.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Thou hast a sister by the mother's side,
Admired Octavia: great Mark Antony
Is now a widower.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Say not so, Agrippa:
If Cleopatra heard you, your reproof
Were well deserved of rashness.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I am not married, Caesar: let me hear
Agrippa further speak.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: To hold you in perpetual amity,
To make you brothers, and to knit your hearts
With an unslipping knot, take Antony
Octavia to his wife; whose beauty claims
No worse a husband than the best of men;
Whose virtue and whose general graces speak
That which none else can utter. By this marriage,
All little jealousies, which now seem great,
And all great fears, which now import their dangers,
Would then be nothing: truths would be tales,
Where now half tales be truths: her love to both
Would, each to other and all loves to both,
Draw after her. Pardon what I have spoke;
For 'tis a studied, not a present thought,
By duty ruminated.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Will Caesar speak?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Not till he hears how Antony is touch'd
With what is spoke already.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: What power is in Agrippa,
If I would say, 'Agrippa, be it so,'
To make this good?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: The power of Caesar, and
His power unto Octavia.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: May I never
To this good purpose, that so fairly shows,
Dream of impediment! Let me have thy hand:
Further this act of grace: and from this hour
The heart of brothers govern in our loves
And sway our great designs!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: There is my hand.
A sister I bequeath you, whom no brother
Did ever love so dearly: let her live
To join our kingdoms and our hearts; and never
Fly off our loves again!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Happily, amen!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I did not think to draw my sword 'gainst Pompey;
For he hath laid strange courtesies and great
Of late upon me: I must thank him only,
Lest my remembrance suffer ill report;
At heel of that, defy him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Time calls upon's:
Of us must Pompey presently be sought,
Or else he seeks out us.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Where lies he?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: About the mount Misenum.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: What is his strength by land?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Great and increasing: but by sea
He is an absolute master.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: So is the fame.
Would we had spoke together! Haste we for it:
Yet, ere we put ourselves in arms, dispatch we
The business we have talk'd of.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: With most gladness:
And do invite you to my sister's view,
Whither straight I'll lead you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Let us, Lepidus,
Not lack your company.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Noble Antony,
Not sickness should detain me.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Flourish. Exeunt OCTAVIUS CAESAR, MARK ANTONY, and LEPIDUS

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MECAENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Welcome from Egypt, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Half the heart of Caesar, worthy Mecaenas! My
honourable friend, Agrippa!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Good Enobarbus!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MECAENAS
SPEECH.LINE: We have cause to be glad that matters are so well
digested. You stayed well by 't in Egypt.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, sir; we did sleep day out of countenance, and
made the night light with drinking.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MECAENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Eight wild-boars roasted whole at a breakfast, and
but twelve persons there; is this true?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: This was but as a fly by an eagle: we had much more
monstrous matter of feast, which worthily deserved noting.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MECAENAS
SPEECH.LINE: She's a most triumphant lady, if report be square to
her.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: When she first met Mark Antony, she pursed up
his heart, upon the river of Cydnus.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: There she appeared indeed; or my reporter devised
well for her.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: I will tell you.
The barge she sat in, like a burnish'd throne,
Burn'd on the water: the poop was beaten gold;
Purple the sails, and so perfumed that
The winds were love-sick with them; the oars were silver,
Which to the tune of flutes kept stroke, and made
The water which they beat to follow faster,
As amorous of their strokes. For her own person,
It beggar'd all description: she did lie
In her pavilion--cloth-of-gold of tissue--
O'er-picturing that Venus where we see
The fancy outwork nature: on each side her
Stood pretty dimpled boys, like smiling Cupids,
With divers-colour'd fans, whose wind did seem
To glow the delicate cheeks which they did cool,
And what they undid did.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: O, rare for Antony!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Her gentlewomen, like the Nereides,
So many mermaids, tended her i' the eyes,
And made their bends adornings: at the helm
A seeming mermaid steers: the silken tackle
Swell with the touches of those flower-soft hands,
That yarely frame the office. From the barge
A strange invisible perfume hits the sense
Of the adjacent wharfs. The city cast
Her people out upon her; and Antony,
Enthroned i' the market-place, did sit alone,
Whistling to the air; which, but for vacancy,
Had gone to gaze on Cleopatra too,
And made a gap in nature.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Rare Egyptian!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Upon her landing, Antony sent to her,
Invited her to supper: she replied,
It should be better he became her guest;
Which she entreated: our courteous Antony,
Whom ne'er the word of 'No' woman heard speak,
Being barber'd ten times o'er, goes to the feast,
And for his ordinary pays his heart
For what his eyes eat only.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Royal wench!
She made great Caesar lay his sword to bed:
He plough'd her, and she cropp'd.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: I saw her once
Hop forty paces through the public street;
And having lost her breath, she spoke, and panted,
That she did make defect perfection,
And, breathless, power breathe forth.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MECAENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Now Antony must leave her utterly.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Never; he will not:
Age cannot wither her, nor custom stale
Her infinite variety: other women cloy
The appetites they feed: but she makes hungry
Where most she satisfies; for vilest things
Become themselves in her: that the holy priests
Bless her when she is riggish.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MECAENAS
SPEECH.LINE: If beauty, wisdom, modesty, can settle
The heart of Antony, Octavia is
A blessed lottery to him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Let us go.
Good Enobarbus, make yourself my guest
Whilst you abide here.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Humbly, sir, I thank you.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. The same. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter MARK ANTONY, OCTAVIUS CAESAR, OCTAVIA between them, and Attendants

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: The world and my great office will sometimes
Divide me from your bosom.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIA
SPEECH.LINE: All which time
Before the gods my knee shall bow my prayers
To them for you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Good night, sir. My Octavia,
Read not my blemishes in the world's report:
I have not kept my square; but that to come
Shall all be done by the rule. Good night, dear lady.
Good night, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Good night.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Now, sirrah; you do wish yourself in Egypt?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soothsayer
SPEECH.LINE: Would I had never come from thence, nor you Thither!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: If you can, your reason?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soothsayer
SPEECH.LINE: I see it in
My motion, have it not in my tongue: but yet
Hie you to Egypt again.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Say to me,
Whose fortunes shall rise higher, Caesar's or mine?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soothsayer
SPEECH.LINE: Caesar's.
Therefore, O Antony, stay not by his side:
Thy demon, that's thy spirit which keeps thee, is
Noble, courageous high, unmatchable,
Where Caesar's is not; but, near him, thy angel
Becomes a fear, as being o'erpower'd: therefore
Make space enough between you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Speak this no more.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soothsayer
SPEECH.LINE: To none but thee; no more, but when to thee.
If thou dost play with him at any game,
Thou art sure to lose; and, of that natural luck,
He beats thee 'gainst the odds: thy lustre thickens,
When he shines by: I say again, thy spirit
Is all afraid to govern thee near him;
But, he away, 'tis noble.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Get thee gone:
Say to Ventidius I would speak with him:
He shall to Parthia. Be it art or hap,
He hath spoken true: the very dice obey him;
And in our sports my better cunning faints
Under his chance: if we draw lots, he speeds;
His cocks do win the battle still of mine,
When it is all to nought; and his quails ever
Beat mine, inhoop'd, at odds. I will to Egypt:
And though I make this marriage for my peace,
I' the east my pleasure lies.
O, come, Ventidius,
You must to Parthia: your commission's ready;
Follow me, and receive't.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. The same. A street.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Trouble yourselves no further: pray you, hasten
Your generals after.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, Mark Antony
Will e'en but kiss Octavia, and we'll follow.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Till I shall see you in your soldier's dress,
Which will become you both, farewell.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MECAENAS
SPEECH.LINE: We shall,
As I conceive the journey, be at the Mount
Before you, Lepidus.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Your way is shorter;
My purposes do draw me much about:
You'll win two days upon me.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MECAENAS
AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, good success!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Farewell.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE V. Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and ALEXAS

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Give me some music; music, moody food
Of us that trade in love.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Attendants
SPEECH.LINE: The music, ho!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Let it alone; let's to billiards: come, Charmian.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: My arm is sore; best play with Mardian.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: As well a woman with an eunuch play'd
As with a woman. Come, you'll play with me, sir?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARDIAN
SPEECH.LINE: As well as I can, madam.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: And when good will is show'd, though't come
too short,
The actor may plead pardon. I'll none now:
Give me mine angle; we'll to the river: there,
My music playing far off, I will betray
Tawny-finn'd fishes; my bended hook shall pierce
Their slimy jaws; and, as I draw them up,
I'll think them every one an Antony,
And say 'Ah, ha! you're caught.'

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: 'Twas merry when
You wager'd on your angling; when your diver
Did hang a salt-fish on his hook, which he
With fervency drew up.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: That time,--O times!--
I laugh'd him out of patience; and that night
I laugh'd him into patience; and next morn,
Ere the ninth hour, I drunk him to his bed;
Then put my tires and mantles on him, whilst
I wore his sword Philippan.
O, from Italy
Ram thou thy fruitful tidings in mine ears,
That long time have been barren.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Madam, madam,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Antonius dead!--If thou say so, villain,
Thou kill'st thy mistress: but well and free,
If thou so yield him, there is gold, and here
My bluest veins to kiss; a hand that kings
Have lipp'd, and trembled kissing.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: First, madam, he is well.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Why, there's more gold.
But, sirrah, mark, we use
To say the dead are well: bring it to that,
The gold I give thee will I melt and pour
Down thy ill-uttering throat.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Good madam, hear me.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Well, go to, I will;
But there's no goodness in thy face: if Antony
Be free and healthful,--so tart a favour
To trumpet such good tidings! If not well,
Thou shouldst come like a Fury crown'd with snakes,
Not like a formal man.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Will't please you hear me?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: I have a mind to strike thee ere thou speak'st:
Yet if thou say Antony lives, is well,
Or friends with Caesar, or not captive to him,
I'll set thee in a shower of gold, and hail
Rich pearls upon thee.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Madam, he's well.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Well said.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: And friends with Caesar.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Thou'rt an honest man.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Caesar and he are greater friends than ever.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Make thee a fortune from me.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: But yet, madam,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: I do not like 'But yet,' it does allay
The good precedence; fie upon 'But yet'!
'But yet' is as a gaoler to bring forth
Some monstrous malefactor. Prithee, friend,
Pour out the pack of matter to mine ear,
The good and bad together: he's friends with Caesar:
In state of health thou say'st; and thou say'st free.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Free, madam! no; I made no such report:
He's bound unto Octavia.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: For what good turn?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: For the best turn i' the bed.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: I am pale, Charmian.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Madam, he's married to Octavia.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: The most infectious pestilence upon thee!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Good madam, patience.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: What say you? Hence,
Horrible villain! or I'll spurn thine eyes
Like balls before me; I'll unhair thy head:
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: She hales him up and down
SPEECH.LINE: Thou shalt be whipp'd with wire, and stew'd in brine,
Smarting in lingering pickle.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Gracious madam,
I that do bring the news made not the match.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Say 'tis not so, a province I will give thee,
And make thy fortunes proud: the blow thou hadst
Shall make thy peace for moving me to rage;
And I will boot thee with what gift beside
Thy modesty can beg.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: He's married, madam.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Rogue, thou hast lived too long.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, then I'll run.
What mean you, madam? I have made no fault.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Good madam, keep yourself within yourself:
The man is innocent.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Some innocents 'scape not the thunderbolt.
Melt Egypt into Nile! and kindly creatures
Turn all to serpents! Call the slave again:
Though I am mad, I will not bite him: call.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: He is afeard to come.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: I will not hurt him.
These hands do lack nobility, that they strike
A meaner than myself; since I myself
Have given myself the cause.
Come hither, sir.
Though it be honest, it is never good
To bring bad news: give to a gracious message.
An host of tongues; but let ill tidings tell
Themselves when they be felt.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: I have done my duty.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Is he married?
I cannot hate thee worser than I do,
If thou again say 'Yes.'

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: He's married, madam.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: The gods confound thee! dost thou hold there still?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Should I lie, madam?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: O, I would thou didst,
So half my Egypt were submerged and made
A cistern for scaled snakes! Go, get thee hence:
Hadst thou Narcissus in thy face, to me
Thou wouldst appear most ugly. He is married?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: I crave your highness' pardon.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: He is married?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Take no offence that I would not offend you:
To punish me for what you make me do.
Seems much unequal: he's married to Octavia.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: O, that his fault should make a knave of thee,
That art not what thou'rt sure of! Get thee hence:
The merchandise which thou hast brought from Rome
Are all too dear for me: lie they upon thy hand,
And be undone by 'em!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Good your highness, patience.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: In praising Antony, I have dispraised Caesar.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Many times, madam.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: I am paid for't now.
Lead me from hence:
I faint: O Iras, Charmian! 'tis no matter.
Go to the fellow, good Alexas; bid him
Report the feature of Octavia, her years,
Her inclination, let him not leave out
The colour of her hair: bring me word quickly.
Let him for ever go:--let him not--Charmian,
Though he be painted one way like a Gorgon,
The other way's a Mars. Bid you Alexas
Bring me word how tall she is. Pity me, Charmian,
But do not speak to me. Lead me to my chamber.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VI. Near Misenum.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Flourish. Enter POMPEY and MENAS at one door, with drum and trumpet: at another, OCTAVIUS CAESAR, MARK ANTONY, LEPIDUS, DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS, MECAENAS, with Soldiers marching

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Your hostages I have, so have you mine;
And we shall talk before we fight.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Most meet
That first we come to words; and therefore have we
Our written purposes before us sent;
Which, if thou hast consider'd, let us know
If 'twill tie up thy discontented sword,
And carry back to Sicily much tall youth
That else must perish here.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: To you all three,
The senators alone of this great world,
Chief factors for the gods, I do not know
Wherefore my father should revengers want,
Having a son and friends; since Julius Caesar,
Who at Philippi the good Brutus ghosted,
There saw you labouring for him. What was't
That moved pale Cassius to conspire; and what
Made the all-honour'd, honest Roman, Brutus,
With the arm'd rest, courtiers and beauteous freedom,
To drench the Capitol; but that they would
Have one man but a man? And that is it
Hath made me rig my navy; at whose burthen
The anger'd ocean foams; with which I meant
To scourge the ingratitude that despiteful Rome
Cast on my noble father.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Take your time.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Thou canst not fear us, Pompey, with thy sails;
We'll speak with thee at sea: at land, thou know'st
How much we do o'er-count thee.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: At land, indeed,
Thou dost o'er-count me of my father's house:
But, since the cuckoo builds not for himself,
Remain in't as thou mayst.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Be pleased to tell us--
For this is from the present--how you take
The offers we have sent you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: There's the point.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Which do not be entreated to, but weigh
What it is worth embraced.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: And what may follow,
To try a larger fortune.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: You have made me offer
Of Sicily, Sardinia; and I must
Rid all the sea of pirates; then, to send
Measures of wheat to Rome; this 'greed upon
To part with unhack'd edges, and bear back
Our targes undinted.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
MARK ANTONY
LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: That's our offer.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Know, then,
I came before you here a man prepared
To take this offer: but Mark Antony
Put me to some impatience: though I lose
The praise of it by telling, you must know,
When Caesar and your brother were at blows,
Your mother came to Sicily and did find
Her welcome friendly.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I have heard it, Pompey;
And am well studied for a liberal thanks
Which I do owe you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Let me have your hand:
I did not think, sir, to have met you here.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: The beds i' the east are soft; and thanks to you,
That call'd me timelier than my purpose hither;
For I have gain'd by 't.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Since I saw you last,
There is a change upon you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Well, I know not
What counts harsh fortune casts upon my face;
But in my bosom shall she never come,
To make my heart her vassal.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Well met here.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: I hope so, Lepidus. Thus we are agreed:
I crave our composition may be written,
And seal'd between us.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: That's the next to do.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: We'll feast each other ere we part; and let's
Draw lots who shall begin.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: That will I, Pompey.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: No, Antony, take the lot: but, first
Or last, your fine Egyptian cookery
Shall have the fame. I have heard that Julius Caesar
Grew fat with feasting there.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: You have heard much.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: I have fair meanings, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: And fair words to them.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Then so much have I heard:
And I have heard, Apollodorus carried--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: No more of that: he did so.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: What, I pray you?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: A certain queen to Caesar in a mattress.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: I know thee now: how farest thou, soldier?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Well;
And well am like to do; for, I perceive,
Four feasts are toward.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Let me shake thy hand;
I never hated thee: I have seen thee fight,
When I have envied thy behavior.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Sir,
I never loved you much; but I ha' praised ye,
When you have well deserved ten times as much
As I have said you did.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Enjoy thy plainness,
It nothing ill becomes thee.
Aboard my galley I invite you all:
Will you lead, lords?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
MARK ANTONY
LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Show us the way, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Come.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Exeunt all but MENAS and ENOBARBUS

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Aside Thy father, Pompey, would ne'er have
made this treaty.--You and I have known, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: At sea, I think.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: We have, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: You have done well by water.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: And you by land.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: I will praise any man that will praise me; though it
cannot be denied what I have done by land.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Nor what I have done by water.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Yes, something you can deny for your own
safety: you have been a great thief by sea.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: And you by land.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: There I deny my land service. But give me your
hand, Menas: if our eyes had authority, here they
might take two thieves kissing.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: All men's faces are true, whatsome'er their hands are.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: But there is never a fair woman has a true face.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: No slander; they steal hearts.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: We came hither to fight with you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: For my part, I am sorry it is turned to a drinking.
Pompey doth this day laugh away his fortune.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: If he do, sure, he cannot weep't back again.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: You've said, sir. We looked not for Mark Antony
here: pray you, is he married to Cleopatra?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Caesar's sister is called Octavia.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: True, sir; she was the wife of Caius Marcellus.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: But she is now the wife of Marcus Antonius.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Pray ye, sir?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis true.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Then is Caesar and he for ever knit together.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: If I were bound to divine of this unity, I would
not prophesy so.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: I think the policy of that purpose made more in the
marriage than the love of the parties.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: I think so too. But you shall find, the band that
seems to tie their friendship together will be the
very strangler of their amity: Octavia is of a
holy, cold, and still conversation.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Who would not have his wife so?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Not he that himself is not so; which is Mark Antony.
He will to his Egyptian dish again: then shall the
sighs of Octavia blow the fire up in Caesar; and, as
I said before, that which is the strength of their
amity shall prove the immediate author of their
variance. Antony will use his affection where it is:
he married but his occasion here.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: And thus it may be. Come, sir, will you aboard?
I have a health for you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: I shall take it, sir: we have used our throats in Egypt.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Come, let's away.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VII. On board POMPEY's galley, off Misenum.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Music plays. Enter two or three Servants with a banquet

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Servant
SPEECH.LINE: Here they'll be, man. Some o' their plants are
ill-rooted already: the least wind i' the world
will blow them down.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Servant
SPEECH.LINE: Lepidus is high-coloured.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Servant
SPEECH.LINE: They have made him drink alms-drink.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Servant
SPEECH.LINE: As they pinch one another by the disposition, he
cries out 'No more;' reconciles them to his
entreaty, and himself to the drink.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Servant
SPEECH.LINE: But it raises the greater war between him and
his discretion.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Servant
SPEECH.LINE: Why, this is to have a name in great men's
fellowship: I had as lief have a reed that will do
me no service as a partisan I could not heave.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Servant
SPEECH.LINE: To be called into a huge sphere, and not to be seen
to move in't, are the holes where eyes should be,
which pitifully disaster the cheeks.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: A sennet sounded. Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, MARK ANTONY, LEPIDUS, POMPEY, AGRIPPA, MECAENAS, DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS, MENAS, with other captains

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: To OCTAVIUS CAESAR Thus do they, sir: they take
the flow o' the Nile
By certain scales i' the pyramid; they know,
By the height, the lowness, or the mean, if dearth
Or foison follow: the higher Nilus swells,
The more it promises: as it ebbs, the seedsman
Upon the slime and ooze scatters his grain,
And shortly comes to harvest.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: You've strange serpents there.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, Lepidus.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Your serpent of Egypt is bred now of your mud by the
operation of your sun: so is your crocodile.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: They are so.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Sit,--and some wine! A health to Lepidus!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: I am not so well as I should be, but I'll ne'er out.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Not till you have slept; I fear me you'll be in till then.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, certainly, I have heard the Ptolemies'
pyramises are very goodly things; without
contradiction, I have heard that.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to POMPEY Pompey, a word.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to MENAS Say in mine ear:
what is't?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to POMPEY Forsake thy seat, I do beseech
thee, captain,
And hear me speak a word.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to MENAS Forbear me till anon.
This wine for Lepidus!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: What manner o' thing is your crocodile?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: It is shaped, sir, like itself; and it is as broad
as it hath breadth: it is just so high as it is,
and moves with its own organs: it lives by that
which nourisheth it; and the elements once out of
it, it transmigrates.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: What colour is it of?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Of it own colour too.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis a strange serpent.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis so. And the tears of it are wet.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Will this description satisfy him?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: With the health that Pompey gives him, else he is a
very epicure.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to MENAS Go hang, sir, hang! Tell me of
that? away!
Do as I bid you. Where's this cup I call'd for?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to POMPEY If for the sake of merit thou
wilt hear me,
Rise from thy stool.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to MENAS I think thou'rt mad.
The matter?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: I have ever held my cap off to thy fortunes.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Thou hast served me with much faith. What's else to say?
Be jolly, lords.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: These quick-sands, Lepidus,
Keep off them, for you sink.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Wilt thou be lord of all the world?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: What say'st thou?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Wilt thou be lord of the whole world? That's twice.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: How should that be?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: But entertain it,
And, though thou think me poor, I am the man
Will give thee all the world.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Hast thou drunk well?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Now, Pompey, I have kept me from the cup.
Thou art, if thou darest be, the earthly Jove:
Whate'er the ocean pales, or sky inclips,
Is thine, if thou wilt ha't.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Show me which way.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: These three world-sharers, these competitors,
Are in thy vessel: let me cut the cable;
And, when we are put off, fall to their throats:
All there is thine.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Ah, this thou shouldst have done,
And not have spoke on't! In me 'tis villany;
In thee't had been good service. Thou must know,
'Tis not my profit that does lead mine honour;
Mine honour, it. Repent that e'er thy tongue
Hath so betray'd thine act: being done unknown,
I should have found it afterwards well done;
But must condemn it now. Desist, and drink.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Aside For this,
I'll never follow thy pall'd fortunes more.
Who seeks, and will not take when once 'tis offer'd,
Shall never find it more.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: This health to Lepidus!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Bear him ashore. I'll pledge it for him, Pompey.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Here's to thee, Menas!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Enobarbus, welcome!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Fill till the cup be hid.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: There's a strong fellow, Menas.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Pointing to the Attendant who carries off LEPIDUS

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Why?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: A' bears the third part of the world, man; see'st
not?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: The third part, then, is drunk: would it were all,
That it might go on wheels!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Drink thou; increase the reels.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Come.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: This is not yet an Alexandrian feast.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: It ripens towards it. Strike the vessels, ho?
Here is to Caesar!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: I could well forbear't.
It's monstrous labour, when I wash my brain,
And it grows fouler.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Be a child o' the time.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Possess it, I'll make answer:
But I had rather fast from all four days
Than drink so much in one.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Ha, my brave emperor!
Shall we dance now the Egyptian Bacchanals,
And celebrate our drink?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: Let's ha't, good soldier.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Come, let's all take hands,
Till that the conquering wine hath steep'd our sense
In soft and delicate Lethe.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: All take hands.
Make battery to our ears with the loud music:
The while I'll place you: then the boy shall sing;
The holding every man shall bear as loud
As his strong sides can volley.
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: Music plays. DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS places them hand in hand
SPEECH.LINE: Come, thou monarch of the vine,
Plumpy Bacchus with pink eyne!
In thy fats our cares be drown'd,
With thy grapes our hairs be crown'd:
Cup us, till the world go round,
Cup us, till the world go round!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: What would you more? Pompey, good night. Good brother,
Let me request you off: our graver business
Frowns at this levity. Gentle lords, let's part;
You see we have burnt our cheeks: strong Enobarb
Is weaker than the wine; and mine own tongue
Splits what it speaks: the wild disguise hath almost
Antick'd us all. What needs more words? Good night.
Good Antony, your hand.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: I'll try you on the shore.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: And shall, sir; give's your hand.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: POMPEY
SPEECH.LINE: O Antony,
You have my father's house,--But, what? we are friends.
Come, down into the boat.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Take heed you fall not.
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: Exeunt all but DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS and MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Menas, I'll not on shore.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: No, to my cabin.
These drums! these trumpets, flutes! what!
Let Neptune hear we bid a loud farewell
To these great fellows: sound and be hang'd, sound out!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Ho! says a' There's my cap.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Ho! Noble captain, come.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. A plain in Syria.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter VENTIDIUS as it were in triumph, with SILIUS, and other Romans, Officers, and Soldiers; the dead body of PACORUS borne before him

SPEECH.SPEAKER: VENTIDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Now, darting Parthia, art thou struck; and now
Pleased fortune does of Marcus Crassus' death
Make me revenger. Bear the king's son's body
Before our army. Thy Pacorus, Orodes,
Pays this for Marcus Crassus.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SILIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Noble Ventidius,
Whilst yet with Parthian blood thy sword is warm,
The fugitive Parthians follow; spur through Media,
Mesopotamia, and the shelters whither
The routed fly: so thy grand captain Antony
Shall set thee on triumphant chariots and
Put garlands on thy head.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: VENTIDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: O Silius, Silius,
I have done enough; a lower place, note well,
May make too great an act: for learn this, Silius;
Better to leave undone, than by our deed
Acquire too high a fame when him we serve's away.
Caesar and Antony have ever won
More in their officer than person: Sossius,
One of my place in Syria, his lieutenant,
For quick accumulation of renown,
Which he achieved by the minute, lost his favour.
Who does i' the wars more than his captain can
Becomes his captain's captain: and ambition,
The soldier's virtue, rather makes choice of loss,
Than gain which darkens him.
I could do more to do Antonius good,
But 'twould offend him; and in his offence
Should my performance perish.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SILIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Thou hast, Ventidius,
that
Without the which a soldier, and his sword,
Grants scarce distinction. Thou wilt write to Antony!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: VENTIDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: I'll humbly signify what in his name,
That magical word of war, we have effected;
How, with his banners and his well-paid ranks,
The ne'er-yet-beaten horse of Parthia
We have jaded out o' the field.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SILIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Where is he now?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: VENTIDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: He purposeth to Athens: whither, with what haste
The weight we must convey with's will permit,
We shall appear before him. On there; pass along!

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. Rome. An ante-chamber in OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter AGRIPPA at one door, DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS at another

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: What, are the brothers parted?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: They have dispatch'd with Pompey, he is gone;
The other three are sealing. Octavia weeps
To part from Rome; Caesar is sad; and Lepidus,
Since Pompey's feast, as Menas says, is troubled
With the green sickness.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis a noble Lepidus.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: A very fine one: O, how he loves Caesar!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, but how dearly he adores Mark Antony!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Caesar? Why, he's the Jupiter of men.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: What's Antony? The god of Jupiter.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Spake you of Caesar? How! the non-pareil!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: O Antony! O thou Arabian bird!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Would you praise Caesar, say 'Caesar:' go no further.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
