SPEECH.LINE: Indeed, he plied them both with excellent praises.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: But he loves Caesar best; yet he loves Antony:
Ho! hearts, tongues, figures, scribes, bards,
poets, cannot
Think, speak, cast, write, sing, number, ho!
His love to Antony. But as for Caesar,
Kneel down, kneel down, and wonder.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Both he loves.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: They are his shards, and he their beetle.
So;
This is to horse. Adieu, noble Agrippa.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Good fortune, worthy soldier; and farewell.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, MARK ANTONY, LEPIDUS, and OCTAVIA

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: No further, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: You take from me a great part of myself;
Use me well in 't. Sister, prove such a wife
As my thoughts make thee, and as my farthest band
Shall pass on thy approof. Most noble Antony,
Let not the piece of virtue, which is set
Betwixt us as the cement of our love,
To keep it builded, be the ram to batter
The fortress of it; for better might we
Have loved without this mean, if on both parts
This be not cherish'd.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Make me not offended
In your distrust.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: I have said.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: You shall not find,
Though you be therein curious, the least cause
For what you seem to fear: so, the gods keep you,
And make the hearts of Romans serve your ends!
We will here part.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Farewell, my dearest sister, fare thee well:
The elements be kind to thee, and make
Thy spirits all of comfort! fare thee well.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIA
SPEECH.LINE: My noble brother!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: The April 's in her eyes: it is love's spring,
And these the showers to bring it on. Be cheerful.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIA
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, look well to my husband's house; and--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: What, Octavia?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIA
SPEECH.LINE: I'll tell you in your ear.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Her tongue will not obey her heart, nor can
Her heart inform her tongue,--the swan's
down-feather,
That stands upon the swell at full of tide,
And neither way inclines.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to AGRIPPA Will Caesar weep?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS He has a cloud in 's face.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to AGRIPPA He were the worse for that,
were he a horse;
So is he, being a man.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS Why, Enobarbus,
When Antony found Julius Caesar dead,
He cried almost to roaring; and he wept
When at Philippi he found Brutus slain.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to AGRIPPA That year, indeed, he was
troubled with a rheum;
What willingly he did confound he wail'd,
Believe't, till I wept too.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: No, sweet Octavia,
You shall hear from me still; the time shall not
Out-go my thinking on you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Come, sir, come;
I'll wrestle with you in my strength of love:
Look, here I have you; thus I let you go,
And give you to the gods.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Adieu; be happy!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LEPIDUS
SPEECH.LINE: Let all the number of the stars give light
To thy fair way!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Farewell, farewell!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Farewell!

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and ALEXAS

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Where is the fellow?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ALEXAS
SPEECH.LINE: Half afeard to come.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Go to, go to.
Come hither, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ALEXAS
SPEECH.LINE: Good majesty,
Herod of Jewry dare not look upon you
But when you are well pleased.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: That Herod's head
I'll have: but how, when Antony is gone
Through whom I might command it? Come thou near.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Most gracious majesty,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Didst thou behold Octavia?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, dread queen.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Where?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Madam, in Rome;
I look'd her in the face, and saw her led
Between her brother and Mark Antony.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Is she as tall as me?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: She is not, madam.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Didst hear her speak? is she shrill-tongued or low?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Madam, I heard her speak; she is low-voiced.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: That's not so good: he cannot like her long.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Like her! O Isis! 'tis impossible.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: I think so, Charmian: dull of tongue, and dwarfish!
What majesty is in her gait? Remember,
If e'er thou look'dst on majesty.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: She creeps:
Her motion and her station are as one;
She shows a body rather than a life,
A statue than a breather.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Is this certain?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Or I have no observance.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Three in Egypt
Cannot make better note.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: He's very knowing;
I do perceive't: there's nothing in her yet:
The fellow has good judgment.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Excellent.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Guess at her years, I prithee.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Madam,
She was a widow,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Widow! Charmian, hark.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: And I do think she's thirty.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Bear'st thou her face in mind? is't long or round?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Round even to faultiness.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: For the most part, too, they are foolish that are so.
Her hair, what colour?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Brown, madam: and her forehead
As low as she would wish it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: There's gold for thee.
Thou must not take my former sharpness ill:
I will employ thee back again; I find thee
Most fit for business: go make thee ready;
Our letters are prepared.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: A proper man.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Indeed, he is so: I repent me much
That so I harried him. Why, methinks, by him,
This creature's no such thing.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Nothing, madam.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: The man hath seen some majesty, and should know.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Hath he seen majesty? Isis else defend,
And serving you so long!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: I have one thing more to ask him yet, good Charmian:
But 'tis no matter; thou shalt bring him to me
Where I will write. All may be well enough.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: I warrant you, madam.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, nay, Octavia, not only that,--
That were excusable, that, and thousands more
Of semblable import,--but he hath waged
New wars 'gainst Pompey; made his will, and read it
To public ear:
Spoke scantly of me: when perforce he could not
But pay me terms of honour, cold and sickly
He vented them; most narrow measure lent me:
When the best hint was given him, he not took't,
Or did it from his teeth.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIA
SPEECH.LINE: O my good lord,
Believe not all; or, if you must believe,
Stomach not all. A more unhappy lady,
If this division chance, ne'er stood between,
Praying for both parts:
The good gods me presently,
When I shall pray, 'O bless my lord and husband!'
Undo that prayer, by crying out as loud,
'O, bless my brother!' Husband win, win brother,
Prays, and destroys the prayer; no midway
'Twixt these extremes at all.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Gentle Octavia,
Let your best love draw to that point, which seeks
Best to preserve it: if I lose mine honour,
I lose myself: better I were not yours
Than yours so branchless. But, as you requested,
Yourself shall go between 's: the mean time, lady,
I'll raise the preparation of a war
Shall stain your brother: make your soonest haste;
So your desires are yours.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIA
SPEECH.LINE: Thanks to my lord.
The Jove of power make me most weak, most weak,
Your reconciler! Wars 'twixt you twain would be
As if the world should cleave, and that slain men
Should solder up the rift.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: When it appears to you where this begins,
Turn your displeasure that way: for our faults
Can never be so equal, that your love
Can equally move with them. Provide your going;
Choose your own company, and command what cost
Your heart has mind to.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE V. The same. Another room.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS and EROS, meeting

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: How now, friend Eros!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: There's strange news come, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: What, man?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: Caesar and Lepidus have made wars upon Pompey.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: This is old: what is the success?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: Caesar, having made use of him in the wars 'gainst
Pompey, presently denied him rivality; would not let
him partake in the glory of the action: and not
resting here, accuses him of letters he had formerly
wrote to Pompey; upon his own appeal, seizes him: so
the poor third is up, till death enlarge his confine.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Then, world, thou hast a pair of chaps, no more;
And throw between them all the food thou hast,
They'll grind the one the other. Where's Antony?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: He's walking in the garden--thus; and spurns
The rush that lies before him; cries, 'Fool Lepidus!'
And threats the throat of that his officer
That murder'd Pompey.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Our great navy's rigg'd.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: For Italy and Caesar. More, Domitius;
My lord desires you presently: my news
I might have told hereafter.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: 'Twill be naught:
But let it be. Bring me to Antony.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: Come, sir.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VI. Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, AGRIPPA, and MECAENAS

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Contemning Rome, he has done all this, and more,
In Alexandria: here's the manner of 't:
I' the market-place, on a tribunal silver'd,
Cleopatra and himself in chairs of gold
Were publicly enthroned: at the feet sat
Caesarion, whom they call my father's son,
And all the unlawful issue that their lust
Since then hath made between them. Unto her
He gave the stablishment of Egypt; made her
Of lower Syria, Cyprus, Lydia,
Absolute queen.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MECAENAS
SPEECH.LINE: This in the public eye?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: I' the common show-place, where they exercise.
His sons he there proclaim'd the kings of kings:
Great Media, Parthia, and Armenia.
He gave to Alexander; to Ptolemy he assign'd
Syria, Cilicia, and Phoenicia: she
In the habiliments of the goddess Isis
That day appear'd; and oft before gave audience,
As 'tis reported, so.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MECAENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Let Rome be thus Inform'd.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Who, queasy with his insolence
Already, will their good thoughts call from him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: The people know it; and have now received
His accusations.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Who does he accuse?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Caesar: and that, having in Sicily
Sextus Pompeius spoil'd, we had not rated him
His part o' the isle: then does he say, he lent me
Some shipping unrestored: lastly, he frets
That Lepidus of the triumvirate
Should be deposed; and, being, that we detain
All his revenue.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, this should be answer'd.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis done already, and the messenger gone.
I have told him, Lepidus was grown too cruel;
That he his high authority abused,
And did deserve his change: for what I have conquer'd,
I grant him part; but then, in his Armenia,
And other of his conquer'd kingdoms, I
Demand the like.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MECAENAS
SPEECH.LINE: He'll never yield to that.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Nor must not then be yielded to in this.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIA
SPEECH.LINE: Hail, Caesar, and my lord! hail, most dear Caesar!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: That ever I should call thee castaway!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIA
SPEECH.LINE: You have not call'd me so, nor have you cause.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Why have you stol'n upon us thus! You come not
Like Caesar's sister: the wife of Antony
Should have an army for an usher, and
The neighs of horse to tell of her approach
Long ere she did appear; the trees by the way
Should have borne men; and expectation fainted,
Longing for what it had not; nay, the dust
Should have ascended to the roof of heaven,
Raised by your populous troops: but you are come
A market-maid to Rome; and have prevented
The ostentation of our love, which, left unshown,
Is often left unloved; we should have met you
By sea and land; supplying every stage
With an augmented greeting.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIA
SPEECH.LINE: Good my lord,
To come thus was I not constrain'd, but did
On my free will. My lord, Mark Antony,
Hearing that you prepared for war, acquainted
My grieved ear withal; whereon, I begg'd
His pardon for return.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Which soon he granted,
Being an obstruct 'tween his lust and him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIA
SPEECH.LINE: Do not say so, my lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: I have eyes upon him,
And his affairs come to me on the wind.
Where is he now?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIA
SPEECH.LINE: My lord, in Athens.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: No, my most wronged sister; Cleopatra
Hath nodded him to her. He hath given his empire
Up to a whore; who now are levying
The kings o' the earth for war; he hath assembled
Bocchus, the king of Libya; Archelaus,
Of Cappadocia; Philadelphos, king
Of Paphlagonia; the Thracian king, Adallas;
King Malchus of Arabia; King of Pont;
Herod of Jewry; Mithridates, king
Of Comagene; Polemon and Amyntas,
The kings of Mede and Lycaonia,
With a more larger list of sceptres.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIA
SPEECH.LINE: Ay me, most wretched,
That have my heart parted betwixt two friends
That do afflict each other!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Welcome hither:
Your letters did withhold our breaking forth;
Till we perceived, both how you were wrong led,
And we in negligent danger. Cheer your heart;
Be you not troubled with the time, which drives
O'er your content these strong necessities;
But let determined things to destiny
Hold unbewail'd their way. Welcome to Rome;
Nothing more dear to me. You are abused
Beyond the mark of thought: and the high gods,
To do you justice, make them ministers
Of us and those that love you. Best of comfort;
And ever welcome to us.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Welcome, lady.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MECAENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Welcome, dear madam.
Each heart in Rome does love and pity you:
Only the adulterous Antony, most large
In his abominations, turns you off;
And gives his potent regiment to a trull,
That noises it against us.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIA
SPEECH.LINE: Is it so, sir?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Most certain. Sister, welcome: pray you,
Be ever known to patience: my dear'st sister!

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VII. Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: I will be even with thee, doubt it not.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: But why, why, why?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Thou hast forspoke my being in these wars,
And say'st it is not fit.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Well, is it, is it?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: If not denounced against us, why should not we
Be there in person?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Aside Well, I could reply:
If we should serve with horse and mares together,
The horse were merely lost; the mares would bear
A soldier and his horse.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: What is't you say?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Your presence needs must puzzle Antony;
Take from his heart, take from his brain,
from's time,
What should not then be spared. He is already
Traduced for levity; and 'tis said in Rome
That Photinus an eunuch and your maids
Manage this war.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Sink Rome, and their tongues rot
That speak against us! A charge we bear i' the war,
And, as the president of my kingdom, will
Appear there for a man. Speak not against it:
I will not stay behind.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, I have done.
Here comes the emperor.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Is it not strange, Canidius,
That from Tarentum and Brundusium
He could so quickly cut the Ionian sea,
And take in Toryne? You have heard on't, sweet?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Celerity is never more admired
Than by the negligent.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: A good rebuke,
Which might have well becomed the best of men,
To taunt at slackness. Canidius, we
Will fight with him by sea.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: By sea! what else?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CANIDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Why will my lord do so?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: For that he dares us to't.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: So hath my lord dared him to single fight.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CANIDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, and to wage this battle at Pharsalia.
Where Caesar fought with Pompey: but these offers,
Which serve not for his vantage, be shakes off;
And so should you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Your ships are not well mann'd;
Your mariners are muleters, reapers, people
Ingross'd by swift impress; in Caesar's fleet
Are those that often have 'gainst Pompey fought:
Their ships are yare; yours, heavy: no disgrace
Shall fall you for refusing him at sea,
Being prepared for land.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: By sea, by sea.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Most worthy sir, you therein throw away
The absolute soldiership you have by land;
Distract your army, which doth most consist
Of war-mark'd footmen; leave unexecuted
Your own renowned knowledge; quite forego
The way which promises assurance; and
Give up yourself merely to chance and hazard,
From firm security.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I'll fight at sea.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: I have sixty sails, Caesar none better.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Our overplus of shipping will we burn;
And, with the rest full-mann'd, from the head of Actium
Beat the approaching Caesar. But if we fail,
We then can do't at land.
Thy business?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: The news is true, my lord; he is descried;
Caesar has taken Toryne.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Can he be there in person? 'tis impossible;
Strange that power should be. Canidius,
Our nineteen legions thou shalt hold by land,
And our twelve thousand horse. We'll to our ship:
Away, my Thetis!
How now, worthy soldier?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: O noble emperor, do not fight by sea;
Trust not to rotten planks: do you misdoubt
This sword and these my wounds? Let the Egyptians
And the Phoenicians go a-ducking; we
Have used to conquer, standing on the earth,
And fighting foot to foot.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Well, well: away!

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Exeunt MARK ANTONY, QUEEN CLEOPATRA, and DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: By Hercules, I think I am i' the right.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CANIDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Soldier, thou art: but his whole action grows
Not in the power on't: so our leader's led,
And we are women's men.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: You keep by land
The legions and the horse whole, do you not?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CANIDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Marcus Octavius, Marcus Justeius,
Publicola, and Caelius, are for sea:
But we keep whole by land. This speed of Caesar's
Carries beyond belief.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: While he was yet in Rome,
His power went out in such distractions as
Beguiled all spies.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CANIDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Who's his lieutenant, hear you?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: They say, one Taurus.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CANIDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Well I know the man.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: The emperor calls Canidius.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CANIDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: With news the time's with labour, and throes forth,
Each minute, some.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VIII. A plain near Actium.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, and TAURUS, with his army, marching

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Taurus!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: TAURUS
SPEECH.LINE: My lord?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Strike not by land; keep whole: provoke not battle,
Till we have done at sea. Do not exceed
The prescript of this scroll: our fortune lies
Upon this jump.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IX. Another part of the plain.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter MARK ANTONY and DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Set we our squadrons on yond side o' the hill,
In eye of Caesar's battle; from which place
We may the number of the ships behold,
And so proceed accordingly.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE X. Another part of the plain.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: CANIDIUS marcheth with his land army one way over the stage; and TAURUS, the lieutenant of OCTAVIUS CAESAR, the other way. After their going in, is heard the noise of a sea-fight

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Naught, naught all, naught! I can behold no longer:
The Antoniad, the Egyptian admiral,
With all their sixty, fly and turn the rudder:
To see't mine eyes are blasted.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SCARUS
SPEECH.LINE: Gods and goddesses,
All the whole synod of them!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: What's thy passion!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SCARUS
SPEECH.LINE: The greater cantle of the world is lost
With very ignorance; we have kiss'd away
Kingdoms and provinces.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: How appears the fight?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SCARUS
SPEECH.LINE: On our side like the token'd pestilence,
Where death is sure. Yon ribaudred nag of Egypt,--
Whom leprosy o'ertake!--i' the midst o' the fight,
When vantage like a pair of twins appear'd,
Both as the same, or rather ours the elder,
The breese upon her, like a cow in June,
Hoists sails and flies.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: That I beheld:
Mine eyes did sicken at the sight, and could not
Endure a further view.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SCARUS
SPEECH.LINE: She once being loof'd,
The noble ruin of her magic, Antony,
Claps on his sea-wing, and, like a doting mallard,
Leaving the fight in height, flies after her:
I never saw an action of such shame;
Experience, manhood, honour, ne'er before
Did violate so itself.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Alack, alack!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CANIDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Our fortune on the sea is out of breath,
And sinks most lamentably. Had our general
Been what he knew himself, it had gone well:
O, he has given example for our flight,
Most grossly, by his own!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, are you thereabouts?
Why, then, good night indeed.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CANIDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Toward Peloponnesus are they fled.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SCARUS
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis easy to't; and there I will attend
What further comes.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CANIDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: To Caesar will I render
My legions and my horse: six kings already
Show me the way of yielding.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: I'll yet follow
The wounded chance of Antony, though my reason
Sits in the wind against me.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE XI. Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Hark! the land bids me tread no more upon't;
It is ashamed to bear me! Friends, come hither:
I am so lated in the world, that I
Have lost my way for ever: I have a ship
Laden with gold; take that, divide it; fly,
And make your peace with Caesar.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: All
SPEECH.LINE: Fly! not we.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I have fled myself; and have instructed cowards
To run and show their shoulders. Friends, be gone;
I have myself resolved upon a course
Which has no need of you; be gone:
My treasure's in the harbour, take it. O,
I follow'd that I blush to look upon:
My very hairs do mutiny; for the white
Reprove the brown for rashness, and they them
For fear and doting. Friends, be gone: you shall
Have letters from me to some friends that will
Sweep your way for you. Pray you, look not sad,
Nor make replies of loathness: take the hint
Which my despair proclaims; let that be left
Which leaves itself: to the sea-side straightway:
I will possess you of that ship and treasure.
Leave me, I pray, a little: pray you now:
Nay, do so; for, indeed, I have lost command,
Therefore I pray you: I'll see you by and by.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter CLEOPATRA led by CHARMIAN and IRAS; EROS following

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, gentle madam, to him, comfort him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: IRAS
SPEECH.LINE: Do, most dear queen.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Do! why: what else?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Let me sit down. O Juno!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: No, no, no, no, no.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: See you here, sir?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: O fie, fie, fie!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Madam!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: IRAS
SPEECH.LINE: Madam, O good empress!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, sir,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Yes, my lord, yes; he at Philippi kept
His sword e'en like a dancer; while I struck
The lean and wrinkled Cassius; and 'twas I
That the mad Brutus ended: he alone
Dealt on lieutenantry, and no practise had
In the brave squares of war: yet now--No matter.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Ah, stand by.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: The queen, my lord, the queen.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: IRAS
SPEECH.LINE: Go to him, madam, speak to him:
He is unqualitied with very shame.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Well then, sustain him: O!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: Most noble sir, arise; the queen approaches:
Her head's declined, and death will seize her, but
Your comfort makes the rescue.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I have offended reputation,
A most unnoble swerving.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, the queen.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: O, whither hast thou led me, Egypt? See,
How I convey my shame out of thine eyes
By looking back what I have left behind
'Stroy'd in dishonour.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: O my lord, my lord,
Forgive my fearful sails! I little thought
You would have follow'd.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Egypt, thou knew'st too well
My heart was to thy rudder tied by the strings,
And thou shouldst tow me after: o'er my spirit
Thy full supremacy thou knew'st, and that
Thy beck might from the bidding of the gods
Command me.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: O, my pardon!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Now I must
To the young man send humble treaties, dodge
And palter in the shifts of lowness; who
With half the bulk o' the world play'd as I pleased,
Making and marring fortunes. You did know
How much you were my conqueror; and that
My sword, made weak by my affection, would
Obey it on all cause.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Pardon, pardon!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Fall not a tear, I say; one of them rates
All that is won and lost: give me a kiss;
Even this repays me. We sent our schoolmaster;
Is he come back? Love, I am full of lead.
Some wine, within there, and our viands! Fortune knows
We scorn her most when most she offers blows.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE XII. Egypt. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, DOLABELLA, THYREUS, with others

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Let him appear that's come from Antony.
Know you him?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOLABELLA
SPEECH.LINE: Caesar, 'tis his schoolmaster:
An argument that he is pluck'd, when hither
He sends so poor a pinion off his wing,
Which had superfluous kings for messengers
Not many moons gone by.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter EUPHRONIUS, ambassador from MARK ANTONY

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Approach, and speak.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EUPHRONIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Such as I am, I come from Antony:
I was of late as petty to his ends
As is the morn-dew on the myrtle-leaf
To his grand sea.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Be't so: declare thine office.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EUPHRONIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Lord of his fortunes he salutes thee, and
Requires to live in Egypt: which not granted,
He lessens his requests; and to thee sues
To let him breathe between the heavens and earth,
A private man in Athens: this for him.
Next, Cleopatra does confess thy greatness;
Submits her to thy might; and of thee craves
The circle of the Ptolemies for her heirs,
Now hazarded to thy grace.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: For Antony,
I have no ears to his request. The queen
Of audience nor desire shall fail, so she
From Egypt drive her all-disgraced friend,
Or take his life there: this if she perform,
She shall not sue unheard. So to them both.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EUPHRONIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Fortune pursue thee!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Bring him through the bands.
To THYREUS To try eloquence, now 'tis time: dispatch;
From Antony win Cleopatra: promise,
And in our name, what she requires; add more,
From thine invention, offers: women are not
In their best fortunes strong; but want will perjure
The ne'er touch'd vestal: try thy cunning, Thyreus;
Make thine own edict for thy pains, which we
Will answer as a law.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: THYREUS
SPEECH.LINE: Caesar, I go.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Observe how Antony becomes his flaw,
And what thou think'st his very action speaks
In every power that moves.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: THYREUS
SPEECH.LINE: Caesar, I shall.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE XIII. Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter CLEOPATRA, DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS, CHARMIAN, and IRAS

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: What shall we do, Enobarbus?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Think, and die.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Is Antony or we in fault for this?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Antony only, that would make his will
Lord of his reason. What though you fled
From that great face of war, whose several ranges
Frighted each other? why should he follow?
The itch of his affection should not then
Have nick'd his captainship; at such a point,
When half to half the world opposed, he being
The meered question: 'twas a shame no less
Than was his loss, to course your flying flags,
And leave his navy gazing.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Prithee, peace.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter MARK ANTONY with EUPHRONIUS, the Ambassador

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Is that his answer?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EUPHRONIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, my lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: The queen shall then have courtesy, so she
Will yield us up.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EUPHRONIUS
SPEECH.LINE: He says so.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Let her know't.
To the boy Caesar send this grizzled head,
And he will fill thy wishes to the brim
With principalities.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: That head, my lord?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: To him again: tell him he wears the rose
Of youth upon him; from which the world should note
Something particular: his coin, ships, legions,
May be a coward's; whose ministers would prevail
Under the service of a child as soon
As i' the command of Caesar: I dare him therefore
To lay his gay comparisons apart,
And answer me declined, sword against sword,
Ourselves alone. I'll write it: follow me.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Aside Yes, like enough, high-battled Caesar will
Unstate his happiness, and be staged to the show,
Against a sworder! I see men's judgments are
A parcel of their fortunes; and things outward
Do draw the inward quality after them,
To suffer all alike. That he should dream,
Knowing all measures, the full Caesar will
Answer his emptiness! Caesar, thou hast subdued
His judgment too.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Attendant
SPEECH.LINE: A messenger from CAESAR.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: What, no more ceremony? See, my women!
Against the blown rose may they stop their nose
That kneel'd unto the buds. Admit him, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Aside Mine honesty and I begin to square.
The loyalty well held to fools does make
Our faith mere folly: yet he that can endure
To follow with allegiance a fall'n lord
Does conquer him that did his master conquer
And earns a place i' the story.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Caesar's will?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: THYREUS
SPEECH.LINE: Hear it apart.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: None but friends: say boldly.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: THYREUS
SPEECH.LINE: So, haply, are they friends to Antony.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: He needs as many, sir, as Caesar has;
Or needs not us. If Caesar please, our master
Will leap to be his friend: for us, you know,
Whose he is we are, and that is, Caesar's.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: THYREUS
SPEECH.LINE: So.
Thus then, thou most renown'd: Caesar entreats,
Not to consider in what case thou stand'st,
Further than he is Caesar.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Go on: right royal.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: THYREUS
SPEECH.LINE: He knows that you embrace not Antony
As you did love, but as you fear'd him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: O!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: THYREUS
SPEECH.LINE: The scars upon your honour, therefore, he
Does pity, as constrained blemishes,
Not as deserved.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: He is a god, and knows
What is most right: mine honour was not yielded,
But conquer'd merely.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Aside To be sure of that,
I will ask Antony. Sir, sir, thou art so leaky,
That we must leave thee to thy sinking, for
Thy dearest quit thee.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: THYREUS
SPEECH.LINE: Shall I say to Caesar
What you require of him? for he partly begs
To be desired to give. It much would please him,
That of his fortunes you should make a staff
To lean upon: but it would warm his spirits,
To hear from me you had left Antony,
And put yourself under his shrowd,
The universal landlord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: What's your name?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: THYREUS
SPEECH.LINE: My name is Thyreus.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Most kind messenger,
Say to great Caesar this: in deputation
I kiss his conquering hand: tell him, I am prompt
To lay my crown at 's feet, and there to kneel:
Tell him from his all-obeying breath I hear
The doom of Egypt.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: THYREUS
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis your noblest course.
Wisdom and fortune combating together,
If that the former dare but what it can,
No chance may shake it. Give me grace to lay
My duty on your hand.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Your Caesar's father oft,
When he hath mused of taking kingdoms in,
Bestow'd his lips on that unworthy place,
As it rain'd kisses.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Re-enter MARK ANTONY and DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Favours, by Jove that thunders!
What art thou, fellow?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: THYREUS
SPEECH.LINE: One that but performs
The bidding of the fullest man, and worthiest
To have command obey'd.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Aside You will be whipp'd.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Approach, there! Ah, you kite! Now, gods
and devils!
Authority melts from me: of late, when I cried 'Ho!'
Like boys unto a muss, kings would start forth,
And cry 'Your will?' Have you no ears? I am
Antony yet.
Take hence this Jack, and whip him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Aside 'Tis better playing with a lion's whelp
Than with an old one dying.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Moon and stars!
Whip him. Were't twenty of the greatest tributaries
That do acknowledge Caesar, should I find them
So saucy with the hand of she here,--what's her name,
Since she was Cleopatra? Whip him, fellows,
Till, like a boy, you see him cringe his face,
And whine aloud for mercy: take him hence.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: THYREUS
SPEECH.LINE: Mark Antony!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Tug him away: being whipp'd,
Bring him again: this Jack of Caesar's shall
Bear us an errand to him.
You were half blasted ere I knew you: ha!
Have I my pillow left unpress'd in Rome,
Forborne the getting of a lawful race,
And by a gem of women, to be abused
By one that looks on feeders?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Good my lord,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: You have been a boggler ever:
But when we in our viciousness grow hard--
O misery on't!--the wise gods seel our eyes;
In our own filth drop our clear judgments; make us
Adore our errors; laugh at's, while we strut
To our confusion.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: O, is't come to this?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I found you as a morsel cold upon
Dead Caesar's trencher; nay, you were a fragment
Of Cneius Pompey's; besides what hotter hours,
Unregister'd in vulgar fame, you have
Luxuriously pick'd out: for, I am sure,
Though you can guess what temperance should be,
You know not what it is.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Wherefore is this?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: To let a fellow that will take rewards
And say 'God quit you!' be familiar with
My playfellow, your hand; this kingly seal
And plighter of high hearts! O, that I were
Upon the hill of Basan, to outroar
The horned herd! for I have savage cause;
And to proclaim it civilly, were like
A halter'd neck which does the hangman thank
For being yare about him.
Is he whipp'd?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Attendant
SPEECH.LINE: Soundly, my lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Cried he? and begg'd a' pardon?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Attendant
SPEECH.LINE: He did ask favour.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: If that thy father live, let him repent
Thou wast not made his daughter; and be thou sorry
To follow Caesar in his triumph, since
Thou hast been whipp'd for following him: henceforth
The white hand of a lady fever thee,
Shake thou to look on 't. Get thee back to Caesar,
Tell him thy entertainment: look, thou say
He makes me angry with him; for he seems
Proud and disdainful, harping on what I am,
Not what he knew I was: he makes me angry;
And at this time most easy 'tis to do't,
When my good stars, that were my former guides,
Have empty left their orbs, and shot their fires
Into the abysm of hell. If he mislike
My speech and what is done, tell him he has
Hipparchus, my enfranched bondman, whom
He may at pleasure whip, or hang, or torture,
As he shall like, to quit me: urge it thou:
Hence with thy stripes, begone!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Have you done yet?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Alack, our terrene moon
Is now eclipsed; and it portends alone
The fall of Antony!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: I must stay his time.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: To flatter Caesar, would you mingle eyes
With one that ties his points?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Not know me yet?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Cold-hearted toward me?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Ah, dear, if I be so,
From my cold heart let heaven engender hail,
And poison it in the source; and the first stone
Drop in my neck: as it determines, so
Dissolve my life! The next Caesarion smite!
Till by degrees the memory of my womb,
Together with my brave Egyptians all,
By the discandying of this pelleted storm,
Lie graveless, till the flies and gnats of Nile
Have buried them for prey!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I am satisfied.
Caesar sits down in Alexandria; where
I will oppose his fate. Our force by land
Hath nobly held; our sever'd navy too
Have knit again, and fleet, threatening most sea-like.
Where hast thou been, my heart? Dost thou hear, lady?
If from the field I shall return once more
To kiss these lips, I will appear in blood;
I and my sword will earn our chronicle:
There's hope in't yet.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: That's my brave lord!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I will be treble-sinew'd, hearted, breathed,
And fight maliciously: for when mine hours
Were nice and lucky, men did ransom lives
Of me for jests; but now I'll set my teeth,
And send to darkness all that stop me. Come,
Let's have one other gaudy night: call to me
All my sad captains; fill our bowls once more;
Let's mock the midnight bell.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: It is my birth-day:
I had thought to have held it poor: but, since my lord
Is Antony again, I will be Cleopatra.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: We will yet do well.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Call all his noble captains to my lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Do so, we'll speak to them; and to-night I'll force
The wine peep through their scars. Come on, my queen;
There's sap in't yet. The next time I do fight,
I'll make death love me; for I will contend
Even with his pestilent scythe.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Now he'll outstare the lightning. To be furious,
Is to be frighted out of fear; and in that mood
The dove will peck the estridge; and I see still,
A diminution in our captain's brain
Restores his heart: when valour preys on reason,
It eats the sword it fights with. I will seek
Some way to leave him.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Before Alexandria. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, AGRIPPA, and MECAENAS, with his Army; OCTAVIUS CAESAR reading a letter

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: He calls me boy; and chides, as he had power
To beat me out of Egypt; my messenger
He hath whipp'd with rods; dares me to personal combat,
Caesar to Antony: let the old ruffian know
I have many other ways to die; meantime
Laugh at his challenge.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MECAENAS
SPEECH.LINE: Caesar must think,
When one so great begins to rage, he's hunted
Even to falling. Give him no breath, but now
Make boot of his distraction: never anger
Made good guard for itself.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Let our best heads
Know, that to-morrow the last of many battles
We mean to fight: within our files there are,
Of those that served Mark Antony but late,
Enough to fetch him in. See it done:
And feast the army; we have store to do't,
And they have earn'd the waste. Poor Antony!

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter MARK ANTONY, CLEOPATRA, DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS, CHARMIAN, IRAS, ALEXAS, with others

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: He will not fight with me, Domitius.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: No.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Why should he not?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: He thinks, being twenty times of better fortune,
He is twenty men to one.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: To-morrow, soldier,
By sea and land I'll fight: or I will live,
Or bathe my dying honour in the blood
Shall make it live again. Woo't thou fight well?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: I'll strike, and cry 'Take all.'

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Well said; come on.
Call forth my household servants: let's to-night
Be bounteous at our meal.
Give me thy hand,
Thou hast been rightly honest;--so hast thou;--
Thou,--and thou,--and thou:--you have served me well,
And kings have been your fellows.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS What means this?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to CLEOPATRA 'Tis one of those odd
tricks which sorrow shoots
Out of the mind.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: And thou art honest too.
I wish I could be made so many men,
And all of you clapp'd up together in
An Antony, that I might do you service
So good as you have done.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: All
SPEECH.LINE: The gods forbid!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Well, my good fellows, wait on me to-night:
Scant not my cups; and make as much of me
As when mine empire was your fellow too,
And suffer'd my command.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS What does he mean?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Aside to CLEOPATRA To make his followers weep.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Tend me to-night;
May be it is the period of your duty:
Haply you shall not see me more; or if,
A mangled shadow: perchance to-morrow
You'll serve another master. I look on you
As one that takes his leave. Mine honest friends,
I turn you not away; but, like a master
Married to your good service, stay till death:
Tend me to-night two hours, I ask no more,
And the gods yield you for't!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: What mean you, sir,
To give them this discomfort? Look, they weep;
And I, an ass, am onion-eyed: for shame,
Transform us not to women.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Ho, ho, ho!
Now the witch take me, if I meant it thus!
Grace grow where those drops fall!
My hearty friends,
You take me in too dolorous a sense;
For I spake to you for your comfort; did desire you
To burn this night with torches: know, my hearts,
I hope well of to-morrow; and will lead you
Where rather I'll expect victorious life
Than death and honour. Let's to supper, come,
And drown consideration.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. The same. Before the palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter two Soldiers to their guard

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Brother, good night: to-morrow is the day.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: It will determine one way: fare you well.
Heard you of nothing strange about the streets?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Nothing. What news?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Belike 'tis but a rumour. Good night to you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Well, sir, good night.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Soldiers, have careful watch.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Third Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: And you. Good night, good night.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: They place themselves in every corner of the stage

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Fourth Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Here we: and if to-morrow
Our navy thrive, I have an absolute hope
Our landmen will stand up.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Third Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis a brave army,
And full of purpose.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Music of the hautboys as under the stage

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Fourth Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Peace! what noise?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: List, list!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Hark!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Music i' the air.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Third Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Under the earth.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Fourth Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: It signs well, does it not?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Third Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: No.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Peace, I say!
What should this mean?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis the god Hercules, whom Antony loved,
Now leaves him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Walk; let's see if other watchmen
Do hear what we do?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: How now, masters!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: All
SPEECH.LINE: Speaking together How now!
How now! do you hear this?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Ay; is't not strange?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Third Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Do you hear, masters? do you hear?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Follow the noise so far as we have quarter;
Let's see how it will give off.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: All
SPEECH.LINE: Content. 'Tis strange.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. The same. A room in the palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter MARK ANTONY and CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, and others attending

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Eros! mine armour, Eros!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Sleep a little.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: No, my chuck. Eros, come; mine armour, Eros!
Come good fellow, put mine iron on:
If fortune be not ours to-day, it is
Because we brave her: come.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, I'll help too.
What's this for?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Ah, let be, let be! thou art
The armourer of my heart: false, false; this, this.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Sooth, la, I'll help: thus it must be.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Well, well;
We shall thrive now. Seest thou, my good fellow?
Go put on thy defences.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: Briefly, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Is not this buckled well?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Rarely, rarely:
He that unbuckles this, till we do please
To daff't for our repose, shall hear a storm.
Thou fumblest, Eros; and my queen's a squire
More tight at this than thou: dispatch. O love,
That thou couldst see my wars to-day, and knew'st
The royal occupation! thou shouldst see
A workman in't.
Good morrow to thee; welcome:
Thou look'st like him that knows a warlike charge:
To business that we love we rise betime,
And go to't with delight.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: A thousand, sir,
Early though't be, have on their riveted trim,
And at the port expect you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Captain
SPEECH.LINE: The morn is fair. Good morrow, general.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: All
SPEECH.LINE: Good morrow, general.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis well blown, lads:
This morning, like the spirit of a youth
That means to be of note, begins betimes.
So, so; come, give me that: this way; well said.
Fare thee well, dame, whate'er becomes of me:
This is a soldier's kiss: rebukeable
And worthy shameful cheque it were, to stand
On more mechanic compliment; I'll leave thee
Now, like a man of steel. You that will fight,
Follow me close; I'll bring you to't. Adieu.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Exeunt MARK ANTONY, EROS, Captains, and Soldiers

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Please you, retire to your chamber.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Lead me.
He goes forth gallantly. That he and Caesar might
Determine this great war in single fight!
Then Antony,--but now--Well, on.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE V. Alexandria. MARK ANTONY's camp.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Trumpets sound. Enter MARK ANTONY and EROS; a Soldier meeting them

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: The gods make this a happy day to Antony!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Would thou and those thy scars had once prevail'd
To make me fight at land!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Hadst thou done so,
The kings that have revolted, and the soldier
That has this morning left thee, would have still
Follow'd thy heels.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Who's gone this morning?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Who!
One ever near thee: call for Enobarbus,
He shall not hear thee; or from Caesar's camp
Say 'I am none of thine.'

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: What say'st thou?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Sir,
He is with Caesar.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, his chests and treasure
He has not with him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Is he gone?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Most certain.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Go, Eros, send his treasure after; do it;
Detain no jot, I charge thee: write to him--
I will subscribe--gentle adieus and greetings;
Say that I wish he never find more cause
To change a master. O, my fortunes have
Corrupted honest men! Dispatch.--Enobarbus!

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VI. Alexandria. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Flourish. Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, AGRIPPA, with DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS, and others

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Go forth, Agrippa, and begin the fight:
Our will is Antony be took alive;
Make it so known.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Caesar, I shall.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: The time of universal peace is near:
Prove this a prosperous day, the three-nook'd world
Shall bear the olive freely.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Antony
Is come into the field.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Go charge Agrippa
Plant those that have revolted in the van,
That Antony may seem to spend his fury
Upon himself.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Alexas did revolt; and went to Jewry on
Affairs of Antony; there did persuade
Great Herod to incline himself to Caesar,
And leave his master Antony: for this pains
Caesar hath hang'd him. Canidius and the rest
That fell away have entertainment, but
No honourable trust. I have done ill;
Of which I do accuse myself so sorely,
That I will joy no more.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Enobarbus, Antony
Hath after thee sent all thy treasure, with
His bounty overplus: the messenger
Came on my guard; and at thy tent is now
Unloading of his mules.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: I give it you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Mock not, Enobarbus.
I tell you true: best you safed the bringer
Out of the host; I must attend mine office,
Or would have done't myself. Your emperor
Continues still a Jove.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: I am alone the villain of the earth,
And feel I am so most. O Antony,
Thou mine of bounty, how wouldst thou have paid
My better service, when my turpitude
Thou dost so crown with gold! This blows my heart:
If swift thought break it not, a swifter mean
Shall outstrike thought: but thought will do't, I feel.
I fight against thee! No: I will go seek
Some ditch wherein to die; the foul'st best fits
My latter part of life.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VII. Field of battle between the camps.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Alarum. Drums and trumpets. Enter AGRIPPA and others

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: Retire, we have engaged ourselves too far:
Caesar himself has work, and our oppression
Exceeds what we expected.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Alarums. Enter MARK ANTONY and SCARUS wounded

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SCARUS
SPEECH.LINE: O my brave emperor, this is fought indeed!
Had we done so at first, we had droven them home
With clouts about their heads.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Thou bleed'st apace.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SCARUS
SPEECH.LINE: I had a wound here that was like a T,
But now 'tis made an H.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: They do retire.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SCARUS
SPEECH.LINE: We'll beat 'em into bench-holes: I have yet
Room for six scotches more.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: They are beaten, sir, and our advantage serves
For a fair victory.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SCARUS
SPEECH.LINE: Let us score their backs,
And snatch 'em up, as we take hares, behind:
'Tis sport to maul a runner.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I will reward thee
Once for thy spritely comfort, and ten-fold
For thy good valour. Come thee on.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SCARUS
SPEECH.LINE: I'll halt after.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VIII. Under the walls of Alexandria.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Alarum. Enter MARK ANTONY, in a march; SCARUS, with others

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: We have beat him to his camp: run one before,
And let the queen know of our gests. To-morrow,
Before the sun shall see 's, we'll spill the blood
That has to-day escaped. I thank you all;
For doughty-handed are you, and have fought
Not as you served the cause, but as 't had been
Each man's like mine; you have shown all Hectors.
Enter the city, clip your wives, your friends,
Tell them your feats; whilst they with joyful tears
Wash the congealment from your wounds, and kiss
The honour'd gashes whole.
Give me thy hand
To this great fairy I'll commend thy acts,
Make her thanks bless thee.
O thou day o' the world,
Chain mine arm'd neck; leap thou, attire and all,
Through proof of harness to my heart, and there
Ride on the pants triumphing!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Lord of lords!
O infinite virtue, comest thou smiling from
The world's great snare uncaught?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: My nightingale,
We have beat them to their beds. What, girl!
though grey
Do something mingle with our younger brown, yet ha' we
A brain that nourishes our nerves, and can
Get goal for goal of youth. Behold this man;
Commend unto his lips thy favouring hand:
Kiss it, my warrior: he hath fought to-day
As if a god, in hate of mankind, had
Destroy'd in such a shape.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: I'll give thee, friend,
An armour all of gold; it was a king's.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: He has deserved it, were it carbuncled
Like holy Phoebus' car. Give me thy hand:
Through Alexandria make a jolly march;
Bear our hack'd targets like the men that owe them:
Had our great palace the capacity
To camp this host, we all would sup together,
And drink carouses to the next day's fate,
Which promises royal peril. Trumpeters,
With brazen din blast you the city's ear;
Make mingle with rattling tabourines;
That heaven and earth may strike their sounds together,
Applauding our approach.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IX. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: If we be not relieved within this hour,
We must return to the court of guard: the night
Is shiny; and they say we shall embattle
By the second hour i' the morn.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: This last day was
A shrewd one to's.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: O, bear me witness, night,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Third Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: What man is this?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Stand close, and list him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: Be witness to me, O thou blessed moon,
When men revolted shall upon record
Bear hateful memory, poor Enobarbus did
Before thy face repent!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Enobarbus!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Third Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Peace!
Hark further.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
SPEECH.LINE: O sovereign mistress of true melancholy,
The poisonous damp of night disponge upon me,
That life, a very rebel to my will,
May hang no longer on me: throw my heart
Against the flint and hardness of my fault:
Which, being dried with grief, will break to powder,
And finish all foul thoughts. O Antony,
Nobler than my revolt is infamous,
Forgive me in thine own particular;
But let the world rank me in register
A master-leaver and a fugitive:
O Antony! O Antony!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Let's speak To him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Let's hear him, for the things he speaks
May concern Caesar.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Third Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Let's do so. But he sleeps.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Swoons rather; for so bad a prayer as his
Was never yet for sleep.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Go we to him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Third Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Awake, sir, awake; speak to us.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Hear you, sir?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: The hand of death hath raught him.
Hark! the drums
Demurely wake the sleepers. Let us bear him
To the court of guard; he is of note: our hour
Is fully out.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Third Soldier
SPEECH.LINE: Come on, then;
He may recover yet.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE X. Between the two camps.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter MARK ANTONY and SCARUS, with their Army

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Their preparation is to-day by sea;
We please them not by land.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SCARUS
SPEECH.LINE: For both, my lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I would they'ld fight i' the fire or i' the air;
We'ld fight there too. But this it is; our foot
Upon the hills adjoining to the city
Shall stay with us: order for sea is given;
They have put forth the haven
Where their appointment we may best discover,
And look on their endeavour.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE XI. Another part of the same.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, and his Army

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: But being charged, we will be still by land,
Which, as I take't, we shall; for his best force
Is forth to man his galleys. To the vales,
And hold our best advantage.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE XII. Another part of the same.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Yet they are not join'd: where yond pine
does stand,
I shall discover all: I'll bring thee word
Straight, how 'tis like to go.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: SCARUS
SPEECH.LINE: Swallows have built
In Cleopatra's sails their nests: the augurers
Say they know not, they cannot tell; look grimly,
And dare not speak their knowledge. Antony
Is valiant, and dejected; and, by starts,
His fretted fortunes give him hope, and fear,
Of what he has, and has not.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Alarum afar off, as at a sea-fight

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: All is lost;
This foul Egyptian hath betrayed me:
My fleet hath yielded to the foe; and yonder
They cast their caps up and carouse together
Like friends long lost. Triple-turn'd whore!
'tis thou
Hast sold me to this novice; and my heart
Makes only wars on thee. Bid them all fly;
For when I am revenged upon my charm,
I have done all. Bid them all fly; begone.
O sun, thy uprise shall I see no more:
Fortune and Antony part here; even here
Do we shake hands. All come to this? The hearts
That spaniel'd me at heels, to whom I gave
Their wishes, do discandy, melt their sweets
On blossoming Caesar; and this pine is bark'd,
That overtopp'd them all. Betray'd I am:
O this false soul of Egypt! this grave charm,--
Whose eye beck'd forth my wars, and call'd them home;
Whose bosom was my crownet, my chief end,--
Like a right gipsy, hath, at fast and loose,
Beguiled me to the very heart of loss.
What, Eros, Eros!
Ah, thou spell! Avaunt!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Why is my lord enraged against his love?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Vanish, or I shall give thee thy deserving,
And blemish Caesar's triumph. Let him take thee,
And hoist thee up to the shouting plebeians:
Follow his chariot, like the greatest spot
Of all thy sex; most monster-like, be shown
For poor'st diminutives, for doits; and let
Patient Octavia plough thy visage up
With her prepared nails.
'Tis well thou'rt gone,
If it be well to live; but better 'twere
Thou fell'st into my fury, for one death
Might have prevented many. Eros, ho!
The shirt of Nessus is upon me: teach me,
Alcides, thou mine ancestor, thy rage:
Let me lodge Lichas on the horns o' the moon;
And with those hands, that grasp'd the heaviest club,
Subdue my worthiest self. The witch shall die:
To the young Roman boy she hath sold me, and I fall
Under this plot; she dies for't. Eros, ho!

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE XIII. Alexandria. Cleopatra's palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and MARDIAN

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Help me, my women! O, he is more mad
Than Telamon for his shield; the boar of Thessaly
Was never so emboss'd.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: To the monument!
There lock yourself, and send him word you are dead.
The soul and body rive not more in parting
Than greatness going off.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: To the monument!
Mardian, go tell him I have slain myself;
Say, that the last I spoke was 'Antony,'
And word it, prithee, piteously: hence, Mardian,
And bring me how he takes my death.
To the monument!

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE XIV. The same. Another room.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Eros, thou yet behold'st me?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, noble lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Sometimes we see a cloud that's dragonish;
A vapour sometime like a bear or lion,
A tower'd citadel, a pendent rock,
A forked mountain, or blue promontory
With trees upon't, that nod unto the world,
And mock our eyes with air: thou hast seen
these signs;
They are black vesper's pageants.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, my lord,

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: That which is now a horse, even with a thought
The rack dislimns, and makes it indistinct,
As water is in water.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: It does, my lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: My good knave Eros, now thy captain is
Even such a body: here I am Antony:
Yet cannot hold this visible shape, my knave.
I made these wars for Egypt: and the queen,--
Whose heart I thought I had, for she had mine;
Which whilst it was mine had annex'd unto't
A million more, now lost,--she, Eros, has
Pack'd cards with Caesar, and false-play'd my glory
Unto an enemy's triumph.
Nay, weep not, gentle Eros; there is left us
Ourselves to end ourselves.
O! thy vile lady!
She has robb'd me of my sword.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARDIAN
SPEECH.LINE: No, Antony;
My mistress loved thee, and her fortunes mingled
With thine entirely.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Hence, saucy eunuch; peace!
She hath betray'd me and shall die the death.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARDIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Death of one person can be paid but once,
And that she has discharged: what thou wouldst do
Is done unto thy hand: the last she spake
Was 'Antony! most noble Antony!'
Then in the midst a tearing groan did break
The name of Antony; it was divided
Between her heart and lips: she render'd life,
Thy name so buried in her.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Dead, then?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARDIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Dead.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Unarm, Eros; the long day's task is done,
And we must sleep.
That thou depart'st hence safe,
Does pay thy labour richly; go.
Off, pluck off:
The seven-fold shield of Ajax cannot keep
The battery from my heart. O, cleave, my sides!
Heart, once be stronger than thy continent,
Crack thy frail case! Apace, Eros, apace.
No more a soldier: bruised pieces, go;
You have been nobly borne. From me awhile.
I will o'ertake thee, Cleopatra, and
Weep for my pardon. So it must be, for now
All length is torture: since the torch is out,
Lie down, and stray no farther: now all labour
Mars what it does; yea, very force entangles
Itself with strength: seal then, and all is done.
Eros!--I come, my queen:--Eros!--Stay for me:
Where souls do couch on flowers, we'll hand in hand,
And with our sprightly port make the ghosts gaze:
Dido and her AEneas shall want troops,
And all the haunt be ours. Come, Eros, Eros!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: What would my lord?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Since Cleopatra died,
I have lived in such dishonour, that the gods
Detest my baseness. I, that with my sword
Quarter'd the world, and o'er green Neptune's back
With ships made cities, condemn myself to lack
The courage of a woman; less noble mind
Than she which by her death our Caesar tells
'I am conqueror of myself.' Thou art sworn, Eros,
That, when the exigent should come, which now
Is come indeed, when I should see behind me
The inevitable prosecution of
Disgrace and horror, that, on my command,
Thou then wouldst kill me: do't; the time is come:
Thou strikest not me, 'tis Caesar thou defeat'st.
Put colour in thy cheek.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: The gods withhold me!
Shall I do that which all the Parthian darts,
Though enemy, lost aim, and could not?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Eros,
Wouldst thou be window'd in great Rome and see
Thy master thus with pleach'd arms, bending down
His corrigible neck, his face subdued
To penetrative shame, whilst the wheel'd seat
Of fortunate Caesar, drawn before him, branded
His baseness that ensued?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: I would not see't.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Come, then; for with a wound I must be cured.
Draw that thy honest sword, which thou hast worn
Most useful for thy country.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: O, sir, pardon me!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: When I did make thee free, sworest thou not then
To do this when I bade thee? Do it at once;
Or thy precedent services are all
But accidents unpurposed. Draw, and come.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: Turn from me, then, that noble countenance,
Wherein the worship of the whole world lies.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Lo thee!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: My sword is drawn.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Then let it do at once
The thing why thou hast drawn it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: My dear master,
My captain, and my emperor, let me say,
Before I strike this bloody stroke, farewell.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis said, man; and farewell.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: Farewell, great chief. Shall I strike now?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Now, Eros.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: EROS
SPEECH.LINE: Why, there then: thus I do escape the sorrow
Of Antony's death.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Thrice-nobler than myself!
Thou teachest me, O valiant Eros, what
I should, and thou couldst not. My queen and Eros
Have by their brave instruction got upon me
A nobleness in record: but I will be
A bridegroom in my death, and run into't
As to a lover's bed. Come, then; and, Eros,
Thy master dies thy scholar: to do thus
I learn'd of thee. How! not dead? not dead?
The guard, ho! O, dispatch me!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Guard
SPEECH.LINE: What's the noise?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I have done my work in, friends: O, make an end
Of what I have begun.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Guard
SPEECH.LINE: The star is fall'n.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Guard
SPEECH.LINE: And time is at his period.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: All
SPEECH.LINE: Alas, and woe!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Let him that loves me strike me dead.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Guard
SPEECH.LINE: Not I.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Guard
SPEECH.LINE: Nor I.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Third Guard
SPEECH.LINE: Nor any one.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DERCETAS
SPEECH.LINE: Thy death and fortunes bid thy followers fly.
This sword but shown to Caesar, with this tidings,
Shall enter me with him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DIOMEDES
SPEECH.LINE: Where's Antony?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DERCETAS
SPEECH.LINE: There, Diomed there.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DIOMEDES
SPEECH.LINE: Lives he?
Wilt thou not answer, man?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Art thou there, Diomed? Draw thy sword, and give me
Sufficing strokes for death.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DIOMEDES
SPEECH.LINE: Most absolute lord,
My mistress Cleopatra sent me to thee.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: When did she send thee?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DIOMEDES
SPEECH.LINE: Now, my lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Where is she?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DIOMEDES
SPEECH.LINE: Lock'd in her monument. She had a prophesying fear
Of what hath come to pass: for when she saw--
Which never shall be found--you did suspect
She had disposed with Caesar, and that your rage
Would not be purged, she sent you word she was dead;
But, fearing since how it might work, hath sent
Me to proclaim the truth; and I am come,
I dread, too late.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Too late, good Diomed: call my guard, I prithee.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DIOMEDES
SPEECH.LINE: What, ho, the emperor's guard! The guard, what, ho!
Come, your lord calls!

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter four or five of the Guard of MARK ANTONY

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Bear me, good friends, where Cleopatra bides;
'Tis the last service that I shall command you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Guard
SPEECH.LINE: Woe, woe are we, sir, you may not live to wear
All your true followers out.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: All
SPEECH.LINE: Most heavy day!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, good my fellows, do not please sharp fate
To grace it with your sorrows: bid that welcome
Which comes to punish us, and we punish it
Seeming to bear it lightly. Take me up:
I have led you oft: carry me now, good friends,
And have my thanks for all.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE XV. The same. A monument.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter CLEOPATRA and her maids aloft, with CHARMIAN and IRAS

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: O Charmian, I will never go from hence.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Be comforted, dear madam.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: No, I will not:
All strange and terrible events are welcome,
But comforts we despise; our size of sorrow,
Proportion'd to our cause, must be as great
As that which makes it.
How now! is he dead?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DIOMEDES
SPEECH.LINE: His death's upon him, but not dead.
Look out o' the other side your monument;
His guard have brought him thither.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter, below, MARK ANTONY, borne by the Guard

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: O sun,
Burn the great sphere thou movest in!
darkling stand
The varying shore o' the world. O Antony,
Antony, Antony! Help, Charmian, help, Iras, help;
Help, friends below; let's draw him hither.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Peace!
Not Caesar's valour hath o'erthrown Antony,
But Antony's hath triumph'd on itself.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: So it should be, that none but Antony
Should conquer Antony; but woe 'tis so!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I am dying, Egypt, dying; only
I here importune death awhile, until
Of many thousand kisses the poor last
I lay up thy lips.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: I dare not, dear,--
Dear my lord, pardon,--I dare not,
Lest I be taken: not the imperious show
Of the full-fortuned Caesar ever shall
Be brooch'd with me; if knife, drugs,
serpents, have
Edge, sting, or operation, I am safe:
Your wife Octavia, with her modest eyes
And still conclusion, shall acquire no honour
Demuring upon me. But come, come, Antony,--
Help me, my women,--we must draw thee up:
Assist, good friends.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: O, quick, or I am gone.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Here's sport indeed! How heavy weighs my lord!
Our strength is all gone into heaviness,
That makes the weight: had I great Juno's power,
The strong-wing'd Mercury should fetch thee up,
And set thee by Jove's side. Yet come a little,--
Wishes were ever fools,--O, come, come, come;
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: They heave MARK ANTONY aloft to CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: And welcome, welcome! die where thou hast lived:
Quicken with kissing: had my lips that power,
Thus would I wear them out.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: All
SPEECH.LINE: A heavy sight!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: I am dying, Egypt, dying:
Give me some wine, and let me speak a little.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: No, let me speak; and let me rail so high,
That the false housewife Fortune break her wheel,
Provoked by my offence.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: One word, sweet queen:
Of Caesar seek your honour, with your safety. O!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: They do not go together.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: Gentle, hear me:
None about Caesar trust but Proculeius.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: My resolution and my hands I'll trust;
None about Caesar.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARK ANTONY
SPEECH.LINE: The miserable change now at my end
Lament nor sorrow at; but please your thoughts
In feeding them with those my former fortunes
Wherein I lived, the greatest prince o' the world,
The noblest; and do now not basely die,
Not cowardly put off my helmet to
My countryman,--a Roman by a Roman
Valiantly vanquish'd. Now my spirit is going;
I can no more.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: Noblest of men, woo't die?
Hast thou no care of me? shall I abide
In this dull world, which in thy absence is
No better than a sty? O, see, my women,
The crown o' the earth doth melt. My lord!
O, wither'd is the garland of the war,
The soldier's pole is fall'n: young boys and girls
Are level now with men; the odds is gone,
And there is nothing left remarkable
Beneath the visiting moon.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: O, quietness, lady!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: IRAS
SPEECH.LINE: She is dead too, our sovereign.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Lady!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: IRAS
SPEECH.LINE: Madam!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: O madam, madam, madam!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: IRAS
SPEECH.LINE: Royal Egypt, Empress!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CHARMIAN
SPEECH.LINE: Peace, peace, Iras!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CLEOPATRA
SPEECH.LINE: No more, but e'en a woman, and commanded
By such poor passion as the maid that milks
And does the meanest chares. It were for me
To throw my sceptre at the injurious gods;
To tell them that this world did equal theirs
Till they had stol'n our jewel. All's but naught;
Patience is scottish, and impatience does
Become a dog that's mad: then is it sin
To rush into the secret house of death,
Ere death dare come to us? How do you, women?
What, what! good cheer! Why, how now, Charmian!
My noble girls! Ah, women, women, look,
Our lamp is spent, it's out! Good sirs, take heart:
We'll bury him; and then, what's brave,
what's noble,
Let's do it after the high Roman fashion,
And make death proud to take us. Come, away:
This case of that huge spirit now is cold:
Ah, women, women! come; we have no friend
But resolution, and the briefest end.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Exeunt; those above bearing off MARK ANTONY's body

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Alexandria. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, AGRIPPA, DOLABELLA, MECAENAS, GALLUS, PROCULEIUS, and others, his council of war

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Go to him, Dolabella, bid him yield;
Being so frustrate, tell him he mocks
The pauses that he makes.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DOLABELLA
SPEECH.LINE: Caesar, I shall.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter DERCETAS, with the sword of MARK ANTONY

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Wherefore is that? and what art thou that darest
Appear thus to us?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DERCETAS
SPEECH.LINE: I am call'd Dercetas;
Mark Antony I served, who best was worthy
Best to be served: whilst he stood up and spoke,
He was my master; and I wore my life
To spend upon his haters. If thou please
To take me to thee, as I was to him
I'll be to Caesar; if thou pleasest not,
I yield thee up my life.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: What is't thou say'st?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DERCETAS
SPEECH.LINE: I say, O Caesar, Antony is dead.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: The breaking of so great a thing should make
A greater crack: the round world
Should have shook lions into civil streets,
And citizens to their dens: the death of Antony
Is not a single doom; in the name lay
A moiety of the world.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DERCETAS
SPEECH.LINE: He is dead, Caesar:
Not by a public minister of justice,
Nor by a hired knife; but that self hand,
Which writ his honour in the acts it did,
Hath, with the courage which the heart did lend it,
Splitted the heart. This is his sword;
I robb'd his wound of it; behold it stain'd
With his most noble blood.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
SPEECH.LINE: Look you sad, friends?
The gods rebuke me, but it is tidings
To wash the eyes of kings.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AGRIPPA
SPEECH.LINE: And strange it is,
